Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: maxinedds
Reviews.Content: Great Service. Stay on the concierge level the amenities, breakfat and cocktail hour and the extra service were well worth it! They helped with advice on shopping, tours, restaurants and were spot on with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Overall and excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: voyageur1980
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at Grand Hyatt hong Kong to celebrate a friend's birthday over the weekend. We booked four rooms in total and everyone had a good time. I personally prefer hotels with boutique-feel; less rooms/suites and more personalized service. I got to admit that the level of service's impeccable. Check in was a breeze. Despite our early arrivals, they managed to accommodate two rooms for early check in which we're grateful for. For a business hotel, the guest service at the reception were excellent; warm, friendly and personal. For frequent travelers, to have a personalized service regardless the number of rooms or if its business or leisure, is crucial as we spent a number of days dining and utilizing services at the hotel. Spacious lobby and grand staircase, with a well-kept 90's feel. Had cocktails at Champagne Bar, a cozy watering hole with exquisite Art Deco architecture and interior. Had coffee and breakfast at Grand Cafe. Service was a little bit slow, but to be expected in a hotel at this scale. Love the free form swimming pool with dedicated lane for you to do your laps. The gym's spacious with enough workout machines. The only downside of our stay was unfortunately the room. The hallway's too tight that two persons could barely fit side-by-side against the bathroom door and the closet. Other than that, great stay. Love the location, we walked everywhere (pretty nice and breezy in the winter months)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent front line staff, good business ambience”
Reviews.Author: go_or_no_go
Reviews.Content: Stayed only for one night and found that the Grand brand has not lost its touch if not improved. I used to complain about how cold and procedural most of the front line staff of HK are but my stay changed my perspective. You can imagine that I have been travelling to HK for more than 10 years now so this notion is not easily undoable until my stay. The check in process was fast, efficient but surprisingly warm as is every approach I make with the front line team considering how busy they were. F&B needs a bit more attention though this is usually the case for large hotels with multiple food and bev outlets. A few areas tend to be overlooked. The facilities and the room were great but there is nothing less to be expected of a Grand Hyatt so I can simply say all is well in these areas. We were interrupted for an hour and a half by our "busy" neighbors but I guess no sound proofing is ready for the amount of noise they were making so I can't really blame that on the hotel. I should have asked for a room transfer but did not think of it during that time and we were only in for on evening.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for concerts at the HK Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: cathie13
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 2 nights as I was going to the Beach Boys concert next door. The rooms are a bit sad, cupboards are the weirdest and the coffee urn is a bit awkward to get to....otherwise they're your standard 5 star hotel room. Hotel is a 5 minute walk from the MTR (A5 exit at wan chai)....harbour views are great and the lounge is excellent...great selection of drinks with free flowing Moet during cocktail hour..pool is ok, sunshine till about 3pm, then the other buildings start to block the sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “Busy but top quality”
Reviews.Author: PHOAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely high quality and very busy. Although I didn't personally encounter any issues with the amount of people in this hotel, I could see queues for taxi's and breakfast tables, all of which were handled very well and as quickly as possible. The staff were amazing, especially the new guy Dominic at the concierge - great sense of humour and only too willing to help. Unfortunately even though I was on a non-smoking floor, there were people smoking in the room across from me - the hotel could benefit in putting up non-smoking signs. The view from the sauna in the female outside pool toilets was a very pleasant surprise. The gym is very well equipped and there was suffidcient equipment to avoid waiting. If you ever feel like non-hotel food, there is a Delifrance sandwich shop that is walking distance across the road, but nothing else unless you go further across or catch a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Huglum
Reviews.Content: Superb location coupled with excellent facilities. Great Harbour views from the room - ensure you opt for a high floor. Breakfast was excellent ans very helpful concierge team. The hotel is slightly expensive but it is Hong Kong and is very convient in the centre of Wan Chai.

Reviews.Title: “The bed is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Rhea L
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights. It is the best mattress I have ever slept on in my life. Big space bathroom with golden taps. People feel free in this great building with anything you can imagine, fitness room, swimming pool, etc. The dinner buffet was copious with excellent sea food. Can never forget.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED our stay”
Reviews.Author: LiLOx
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Grand Hyatt. We found the service to be personal and attentive, our room was phenomenal - all around - nothing but great things to say about this place. Great location as well! Very convenient to the Wan Chai ferry stop, as well as easy walk/cab to anywhere on Hong Kong Island. Really fantastic establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: FJDaiker
Reviews.Content: i was stay there for my honeymoon. and the room view was awesome. facing the Hongkong Harbour, it was fascinating, love it! Great building ( I'm a big fans of building architect ), great service , great location. for me to conclude my stay in Grand Hyatt Hongkong is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: valentina v
Reviews.Content: Lets start by good things - the concierge service was excellent, the lobby area is really nice. The gym was modern, clean, with great service and provided shoes. But the standard room was tiny and there is a terrible smell of old carpets in the corridor and the room. It was nearly impossible to sleep in the room because of the loud music until the late night from the garden. I tried to change the room for the rooms without carpets in the spa level, but refused to pay almost the twice the price for this. The room service food was not eatable, except the breakfast provided at any time of the day as room service. The wifi was expensive. Strange bar in the lobby level. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Luxury”
Reviews.Author: dwatson4
Reviews.Content: This is prime location, exemplary service, food, scenery and the rooms are spacious and immaculate. The best part was BBQ with lobster and steak, candle lit walk to the out door champagne bar. The entrance is as grand as grand will get, afternoon tea is a must in the hotel and two mins walk to exhibition centre

Reviews.Title: “Best five stars hotel I stayed in”
Reviews.Author: travelmaniaFirenze
Reviews.Content: The grand hyatt hong kong offers unique atmosphere, service and customer care. Breakfast,buffets and food in general satisfy the expectations. Rooms are very confortable and chic. The roof pool is just amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: Stuart J
Reviews.Content: 192 stays in one hotel over 8 years is a considerable achievement and confirms the hotel is providing the excellent service I look for when I stay in Hong Kong. Repeat guests are key to any hotel's success and indeed ensuring that guests have a pleasant and comfortable stay with value for money must be the objective of any hotel chain. Hyatt is my favourite chain and provides a level of service that is well known, consistent, easy to understand and book and value for money. In addition with their points programs, you have a good chance of getting a free stay next time especially as they have periods of the year when they give extra points to encourage you to stay. The Grand Hyatt Hotel Wanchai is very well situated next to the convention centre and within 5 min from Central by the hotel's London taxi. It's even closer to the airport express terminal now because of the new road that runs directly from the terminal to the hotel along the reclaimed land next to the new Hong Kong government building. Its easy to connect with any part of Hong Kong, through an easy covered walking distance to the Wan chai MTR train station. The property has avey pleasant location and and outlook over the harbour. Most of the rooms have harbour views over the convention centre and are well laid out with excellent facilities. It's the people who make a hotel and of course there are too many to mention. The important ones are of course Jeff the manager of the Bell desk, Jake and Scott in the Grand Club lounge. Yorky the speedy bellboy, Grace who answers the phone and Karen who answers the room service phone. Winnie, Fred and Gordon are the management and it is to their credit that the hotel is so well run. So what do I recommend? Ensure you have a Harborview room but of course that's to be expected, because a high percentage of the rooms do have a Harborview. Pay to upgrade to the Grand Club lounge and enjoy the excellent breakfast, with harbour views, the all day wine service, and the excellent cocktails in the evening. From 530pm till 730pm everyday the cocktails are tremendous and get there early to grab a first-class seat by the window. Try the spa, the Grand Cafe, ride in the London taxi to Central and at the same time just enjoy the five-star luxury located conveniently next to the convention centre. Don't forget that the Australian embassy is 10 minutes walk away, the Immigration Department and Tax department are just across the road in Wan Chai Take my advice, stay there and enjoy the ambiance. You cant beat it!!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in hong kong”
Reviews.Author: paolacohen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past and wanted to give it another try on a sunny week end in Hong Kong, good decision because the pool is the best almost you feel you really are in a resort The room is spacious, I love that the hot water is always on and reedy to pour for tea or coffee For Hong Kong standard the rooms are spacious and the bathroom is very nice all marble and plush towels This is a 5 stars hotel with excellent service and great dining, we had a great week end we never left the premises and enjoy all the different restaurants: great pool buffet for lunch and dinner Loved it

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: linda w
Reviews.Content: CHECK IN: Wonderful experience overall! ROOMS: Small, but all rooms are small in HK, however it was clean and well designed with lots of room to put everything away and a great view of the harbor. Bathroom was modern with lots of room for toiletry bags. Outlets for charging phones were limited by the bed but 2 outlets near desk. CONCIERGE: They were very helpful with great directions for ferries to nearby islands or great restaurants nearby. FOOD: Breakfast buffet was very good but we mostly ate other meals outside the hotel. CHECK OUT: Very easy! LOCATION: Wonderful location within walking distance of everything! HK is one of my favorite cities and the Hyatt showcases it beautifully!

Reviews.Title: “Mature & Good”
Reviews.Author: Olga B
Reviews.Content: Impeccable reception and service all around. A true 5 star breakfast buffet + a la cart is available. Reliable quality selections of restaurants within the hotel: Italian, steak, Japanese, Chinese + 2 bars. Comfortable beds and rooms...although not new - the down side is that drainage can be slightly noisy and shower head stream is not even. Fantastic harbour view. One of the best sw. pools, gym, sauna and spa. Perfect location for Convention Centre business meetings, only 5 min. to Central by taxi. This hotel also has one of the best ball rooms and even a high end hair salon.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: LovedHongKong
Reviews.Content: We were at the Grand Hyatt in Hong Kong for a friend's wedding and this hotel is fantastic! We highly recommend staying on the club floors - the club lounge has amazing views of the harbour and the night light show. All the food and drinks on the club floor lounge are included, and SOOO worth it! Amazing service too - our glasses were never empty!! Service on the club floor level was superb and we highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great location and great stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Best view for the money”
Reviews.Author: ETJ3822
Reviews.Content: I realize this is not an inexpensive hotel but compared to some of the other top rated hotels with a Hong Kong harbor view, I think this is the best value for the money. Be sure to ask for a room overlooking the harbor and not the city. And the best part is the room size which I believe is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rollo T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Service is highest I saw for the whole life. They gave us Moët shampagne every day at the club longe

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: TooshMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night last year. The room was very nice, spacious and fairly updated. Bathroom also good...quite large actually. We had a room with a harbor view, but we're on a lower floor so not as great a view. Friend traveling with me said the bar was very nice, but I wasn't there. Check in and check ou was quick and professional. Overall a good experience. Cloe to bars and Restos in Wan Chai..walked too and back from a great spot called the Pawn Shop.

Reviews.Title: “Good business Hotel, but getting older”
Reviews.Author: Sharkdive1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite some Hyatts or Grand Hyatts. The one in Hong Kong is nice, but not more compared to some others. Rooms deserve to be renovated soon (at least the one I've had). Room equipment is really at the lower side (compared to other hotels in HK). They even don't have wine glasses although the mini bar offers wines. When we ordered glasses and used them, they were not cleaned the other day but stayed there. Staff very friendly. Breakfast is great, but rather at the upper side when it comes to pricing. They also serve a really good buffet over lunch time. Try it out. You won't be disappointed. Location is a little bit difficult to reach. In essence you need a taxi wherever you want to go. Pool area is nice, too

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite for a week. It was awesome. Breakfast was in room and silver service every day. Restaurants inhouse were fantastic. Staff were helpfull. A touch expensive but worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: SYD-YYZ
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 night stay recently whilst attending a convention next door. Nothing is too much trouble for the team at GH. Rooms have spectacular views of the Harbour. The bathroom was certainly full of bling but even my toddlers were impressed with the bath! Really appreciated having the hot water warmer in room. Breakfast very steep in price but has a wide range of choices. Pool and gym are also amazing. 10 mins walk to Wanchai MTR which is far in the humid weather esp. for little ones but otherwise a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: diegodoc
Reviews.Content: It is my third time there, and as always, a great Place. Just backing the new built Convention Center in Wan Chai, this hotel is just 5 minutes away from Star Ferry docking. We get this room with a ceiling-to-floor window with a spectacur view from the Bay. I highly suggest this option for this hotel, pricy but very impressive, for the overall wuslity of services.

Reviews.Title: “Hayatt therapy”
Reviews.Author: NS0129
Reviews.Content: It was our wedding anniversary, and we had a fantastic time. Everything is clean, organized, and professional. We had harbor view room which was very entertaining and beautiful, and the lounge was also very good. It helped us having a sophisticated moment. We were able to forget our daily mess and refreshed. Surely we will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the hotel twice in a week”
Reviews.Author: kirk7_2002
Reviews.Content: Check-in was efficient- Anna was fantastic The lobby was very busy...my taxi driver tells me that this property is now the first choice for high ranking mainland officials...i guess thats why it was full of mainland Chinese- very busy. The room was looking into another building, quite small- twin beds with a sofa....I'm platinum and normally I get a decent room. wifi internet was pretty fast...room was clean. breakfast was pretty steep for my liking...it was top notch though. checkout was painless.... concierge was efficient and they were helpful in booking a table at my favourite local restaurant. bell desk was efficient and helpful location is not the most convenient as you need to walk in the humid conditions (june 2012) but there is usually always taxi waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Good...and kind of vulgar (but in a nice way)”
Reviews.Author: JakobHagman
Reviews.Content: Having loved the Park Hyatt of Tokyo I was really excited to stay at the Grand Hyatt in Hong Kong. The service is as expected impeccable. Choose one of the harbor view rooms! 2716 is great with a fantastic sunset over the harbor every night! Don't go for the cheaper options with a view facing a fairly dull back yard. The lobby is not my cup of tea with it's enormous columns, but I will have to look beyond that thanks to the amazing view from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: Estrella D
Reviews.Content: Our one-week stay at Grand Hyatt HK last month was in one word PERFECT! The Hotel is grand and the staff beautiful. Jake, Maggie, Scott and Mark were amazing, always very professional with a personal touch. We are definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: richard f
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is the best hotel experience we have ever had. We have enjoyed the hospitality here 4 times in recent years and the experience is consistently outstanding. The Grand Club is Hyatt's best in the world under mecurial leadership of Jake. Nothing is too much trouble from housekeeping, concierge, driveway assistance, front desk, spa, poolside - everything just operates perfectly. Well done Gordan and team. R+J Aust

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: JYAustralia
Reviews.Content: Great Service... from start to end of stay..............I will be Back... again and again!!! Thank You !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff and Beautiful Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl K
Reviews.Content: We visited the last week in April. This will be my hotel destination in Hong Kong for our next trip. The Staff is A+++ Friendly, Accommodating, 1st Class. The Food is delicious. We enjoyed the Barbecue poolside. The Club Lounge is Outstanding..the Best. Our room was so comfortable and every night I slept well. I didn't experience any jet lag at all (until returning home). Very convenient to the convention center next door. Harbor ferry was less than $1 and walking every where was a pleasure. It was fun to see such a blending of cultures. Great trip and look forward to returning asap.

Reviews.Title: “"G4 sisters' Grand bonding at Grand Hyatt"”
Reviews.Author: Laura_DSA
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt Hotel lives up to it's name, being grand and all!!! Awesome room views, the food was superb, furnishings were of excellent quality, and the service was impeccable! We stayed for a week and every moment spent was simply unforgettable. Special thanks to our warm greeters/ friends/ entertainers at the grand club, Jake, Magi, Scott, "uncle"and Mark! We miss you! We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Five star service”
Reviews.Author: Sandra L
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in a club room .. unfortunately we were so busy we only used the club room for breakfast .. staff were at all time very attentive.. the rooms were immaculate and well appointed .. only a little inconvenient to the MTR as a taxi had to used to get to the shops but there were always taxis readily available and they are so cheap anyway..the pool area was fantastic and a great place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Five star experience”
Reviews.Author: GouFam
Reviews.Content: Experience 5 star luxury at Grand Hyatt Hong Kong, ideally situated in the heart of the city, our beautiful suite offered stunning views of the famous Victoria Harbour. The rooms are well appointed and are of 5 star standard and quite large with a stunning bathroom. This hotel was faultless on all levels, my husband and I spent 4 night at this stunning hotel and would return in a heartbeat. Exceptional service and a well equipped gym/spa and stunning swimming pool and bar area make this one of the most magnificent properties we have encountered. The dinner at 1 Harbour road restaurant is beautiful with wonderful service......

Reviews.Title: “5* Luxury and great service”
Reviews.Author: jscHongKong
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 8 to 8 promotion and enjoyed every minute. The rooms are well appointed and the pool was lovely. All the staff were courteous and professional. The F&B were of the highest possible standard. We will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing property and staff”
Reviews.Author: Ryan C
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here last week for 4 days in a Executive Suite. What an amazing property. The room was quite large for Hong Kong standards and had a nice large bathroom, sitting room, and bedroom. The amazing staff is really what makes this hotel exceptional. Everyone we interacted with went out of their way to give us attention and help. The concierge team made amazing recommendations, and every restaurant they told us to visit was amazing. The grand club was also amazing. With great views of the harbour and surrounding areas, it provided a great place to relax, eat the amazing breakfast spread, or the great dinner spread. Drinks are also provided from 5:30-7:30. It has a great location that makes it a quick cab ride to Lan Kwai Fong where we spent most nights going out on the town. It is also a quick 5 minute walk to the star ferry where you can ride to TST. I highly recommend this hotel and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when I visit Hong Kong again, which is hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Best Club Lounge in Hyatt System”
Reviews.Author: DiamondGP80
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. I stayed here twice last year and was going to again last month, although had to cancel due to last-minute change in my schedule. Every stay was near perfect and overall this is a fantastic hotel with a great Club lounge and outstanding service. Check-in was always efficiently done and as a Diamond member with Hyatt Gold Passport program, I would always be escorted up to my room. The staff also carefully went through the benefits I was entitled to as a Diamond member. These little touches did make me feel like they really valued my business. I was always allocated a room on the Club floor although never upgraded to harbor view room. I didn't find a harbor view room necessary as the view from the Kowloon side was miles better anyway. The top 8 floors of the hotel were designated as Club floors. The room was fairly small and looked and felt dated, but it was spotlessly clean and everything worked. I didn't like the bathroom though, it felt very 90s, and the garish gold plated tap and fixtures were vomit-inducing. The Grand Club lounge was very grand and had expansive view of the harbor. The atmosphere felt a bit stuffy at times and I felt like I had to be prim and proper and be in my best behavior at all times. That said, the service was exemplary. Although not the friendliest bunch, the wait staff was very efficient and after the first visit, they would remember my drinks of choice, how I take your coffee, etc. and brought these the next time I visit the lounge, without even being asked. Again, the service here was truly impeccable, it seemed that the staff could anticipate my needs even before me. Food selection during service hours was extensive and alcohol was available all day, although they did save the best stuff for the cocktail hours. This was truly the best Club lounge experience I had. Although, perhaps, the problem with it being so awesome is that guests tend to linger in the lounge, so it could get very crowded indeed. One evening, there was a line to get tables and guests ended up sharing tables with other guests, and the staff was literally running around the lounge. Not something that I expected in a property that was priced as high as this. I found the Club Concierges tended to be a bit aloof though. Unlike their colleagues at the other Hyatt across the harbor who is always beaming with smiles and saying "Good Morning, etc" whenever I enter the lounge, the Club Concierges here didn't even look up from their computer screen whenever a guest entered the lounge. In fairness, when I approached them, they were polite and not rude. Location-wise, there was little to see and do around the hotel. But the Wan Chai MTR station was an easy 7-10 minutes walk from the hotel via a covered footbridge. From here, I could easily get anywhere in Hong Kong. Overall, this is a fantastic property with a great Club lounge and outstanding service. Although the interior and the overall feel of the hotel is not to my liking, I probably would have made this my home in Hong Kong, if not because of the very expensive price tag.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Dame”
Reviews.Author: Gris M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at The Grand Hyatt at least once a year. See I'm a resident of Hong Kong and this is one of our favorite city escapes within the city. With grand sweeping views of the harbor, visitors requesting a harbor view room feel like kings high above the Hong Kong skyline. Some of the best restaurants in HK are located in this complex. If you feel like splurging, book a spa suite for an extra zen experience. Much needed when the city bakes you.

Reviews.Title: “A superb stay, excellent lounge, especially from manager, Jake.”
Reviews.Author: JaimitoCartero
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent arrival, and check in with the club manager Jake. He showed us to our room, and was superb in all ways imaginable. The club desk staff was very helpful with recommendations, and always willing to help out. Breakfast was quite nice in the lounge, with superb quality. Some of the best blueberries I've had in many years. Evening cocktails were also excellent. A nice spread, and an excellent view. Only had slow service once, when we were seated in the library, towards the end of service, and Jake was off. We had a nice harbor view, although with the channel construction, it wasn't quite as scenic. Lots of restaurants nearby. We tried the Superstar Seafood across the street for Dim Sum, as well as Indonesian at Cinta J's a few blocks away at 69 Jaffe Rd. Both are about $15-$30 per person. Cinta J's is a relaxed type place. Turns into a bit of a pub later at night with singers, but good for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Superlative service at Grand Hyatt Club”
Reviews.Author: steph1951
Reviews.Content: Jake and his team are to be congratulated on their outstanding service with a smile. No task was too large. They managed the best seats in restaurants, posted large parcels with minimum of fuss, treated us like family. The Club breakfast is wonderful and the drinks and hors d'ourves at the the of the day so welcoming and delicious. There is always someone to make you feel welcome. Scott in particular. There may be grander hotels in Hong Kong but we would never change, we love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Hong Kong for the Art Fair I was very fortunate to spend a week at this wonderful hotel. Checked in on the 30th Floor (executive level), Jackie on reception was most welcoming, warm and helpful. The room was perfect for my needs. Most of our free time was spent at the Grand Club lounge where the service was impeccable. Jake and his Grand Club team worked tirelessly to provide the best experience possible. Even at busy times the lounge team never failed to exceed our expectations. The food was delicious and the range extensive, so much so we struggled to leave a little room for dinner! Our glasses were never empty. I could not fault one thing about our stay. From arrival until departure everything about this hotel was exceptional. If you visit Hong Kong Grand Hyatt is a must!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt makes every HK stay GRAND!”
Reviews.Author: alicedjones
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt HKl exemplifies what a great hotel should be about: giving guests a pleasurable travel experience. It's the people, not the physical structure, that stays in the mind & the heart. Not to say there's much that needs changing in the structure either. I love the understated vibe of the #17 rooms and the Grand Club.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded into Harbour Front Room - Construction Noise”
Reviews.Author: andyjohn1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel...but construction on Harbour side was more than unpleasant. I sleep soundly, but could not manage it once the jackhammers started early every morning. The pool restaurant and bar seem very nice. Will not be back until I know construction is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Home Plus, away from Home”
Reviews.Author: DWV1029
Reviews.Content: On your travels away from home, the Grand Club at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong, will cater to every comfort and utility need in the meantime. Concierge service for visas to onward destinations, meeting rooms and business center for your business needs, a Club Lounge with a spectacular HK harbor view available all day and a staff that remembers and responds to your every need. For me it's a one stop shop of business and comfort. I highly recommend. D

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S C
Reviews.Content: Want to stay at a truly exceptional hotel? Stay at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong, and more specifically its Grand Club level. I have been staying at the hotel for many years when in town on business and am more impressed with the outstanding service on each stay. The Grand Club is an oasis from the bustling city. The staff is wonderful. They know your by name and personal preferences upon first time check in. The breakfast and evening hor' dourves/cocktails on the club level are special. Sipping a hot coffee (preferences automatically arrive at table after your first morning), eating fresh fruit (among the full buffet breakfast offerings including fruit, yogurt, muesli, cereal, dim sum, eggs, pastries, salmon, cheese, etc.), while enjoying a beautiful view of the Hong Kong harbor cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: MoxieGreen
Reviews.Content: I had the great fortune to spend Easter weekend in Hong Kong and on the recommendation of friends chose to splurge for a stay on the Grand Hyatt Club floor. I've traveled quite a bit and stayed in some impressive places, but can say without hesitation that this hotel showed me the best service I've ever experienced. If you've ever wondered what it's like to be a star, stay here, you're guaranteed to feel like one. From the minute you pull up in the car and your bags disappear before you can unbuckle your seatbelt, til the time you check out, there is nothing this hotel won't bend over backwards to make happen. Want slippers that fit your smaller feet? No problem. Need something to tame your hair that's discovered Hong Kong's humidity is hard to handle? It's on its way up to your room. You never have to wait for someone to ask how they can help you. Absolutely marvelous. Speaking of... Did I mention the food? Breakfast - a fantastic spread that includes smoked salmon and champagne (what else does a girl need first thing in the morning?) is served overlooking a fabulous view of the Victoria harbour. As is the complimentary 'cocktail hour' which is a bit of a misnomer since the fabulous spread can easily double as dinner. I could go on, but I think you get the picture. Special thanks to Scott, who literally ran the club lounge so smoothly I worry about how many times a year he needs to re-sole his shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a wonderful pool”
Reviews.Author: gigigolf
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Grand Hyatt, spend aliitle more and get an executive level room... The club has a fabulous breakfast and perfect view of Kowloon and the river. Hotel is in a good location, within walking distance to mrt, which is very important in HK because of the traffic. We used the Mrt to go to the temple night market and over to Kowloon to shop, was very easy and quick. Wonderful staff and service in this hotel, the employees could not have been any more friendly or willing to help... I ask alot of questions about touring around the city and the concierge staff always had the answers!

Reviews.Title: “Best Spa Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kate M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a weekend at Grand Hyatt HK. The hotel is centrally located, less than a 5 minute taxi ride away from the best shopping, restaurant and bars. Our room benefited from great harbour views and was quite spacious. We qualified for Club level access, this was one of the highlights of our stay. They provide a very generous range of yummy food for breakfast and evening cocktails. another great surprise was the free flow Moet! The staff there are very attentive and friendly. My husband treated me to a 90 minute facial at the in-house spa. The entire 11th floor is dedicated to Spa and recreation. It was truly a very relaxing and pleasant experience. The treatment rooms, products used and staff are top rate. A special mention to Suki my therapist for one of the best facials ever! The outdoor pool whilst aesthetically pleasing is also a very welcome oasis in this buzzing city. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thorsten L
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong. The hotel is centrally located with full view of the Hong Kong harbour. Rooms are spacy (ask for a harbor view room) and the Grand Club Lounge is outstanding (very nice food - including fresh salad, foie gras, fruits as well as nice wine and Moet&Chandon champagne complimentary at cocktail hour). Staff is extremely friendly (watch out for Scott - he is a great host!). Always again!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, ok value”
Reviews.Author: pammyvancouver
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that we got a good corp rate. We were a group of 18 and managed to get a good rate (by HK standards). We are a group from North Am, and travelled to HK via Shanghai. In Shanghai we stayed at the Westin Bund and got free in-room wifi plus free buffet breakfast. When we got to HK, we thought( since we were a large group) we could get at least free wifi, but no-no, they would not give it to us...a bit deflating. We did not even get free breakfast. And really, how much does it actually cost the hotel to give us wifi??? Peanuts. Oh well. Big room for HK standards and an even bigger bathroom....we did not really care as we were in HK not to stay in the rooms. Decent view room. Club floors have a panoramic 180 degree view of the harbour. So, how to solve my internet and breakfast problem? 1. across the street are the HK govt buildings...free wifi in there on weekdays only. 2. across the street is Cafe de Coral (inside the Shui On building)...great selection of western eggs+bacon plus Chinese breakfast. Good HK style coffee. Cheap. HK20-25 for breakfast...dont pay thru your nose at the Hyatt for breakfast About a 5-10 min walk away is the Wanchai MTR station. Cabs costs about HK20-30 to most places closely like Central, Lan Kwai Fong, etc. Now, they did give me a late checkout, so it makes up for me being grumpy for the lack of wifi and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Made for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Erica R
Reviews.Content: Recently I attended the most incredible wedding in Hong Kong. Hosted by The Grand Hyatt Hong Kong. So of course, I am thinking expensive and rather pretentious. OMG was I wrong... this was the most tourist friendly, comfortable, choice my host's could have made (David you rock) and (rooks) From day one the service provided by Jake, Grand Club was exceptional and beyond explanation. It's not often that I write reviews and give kudos but OMG I cannot wait to return. Thank you to all. D & K you rock the Situation!!!

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gloria K
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband and I were in Hong Kong to attend a wedding which took place at the Grand Hyatt. We decided to book into the hotel for the weekend and were not disappointed with the quality of service. Our room was beautiful, and large with a spectacular bathroom. We had a lovely view of Victoria Harbour, Hong Kong and Kowloon. The food and service at the wedding was unbeatable The staff in the Business Office were friendly and very helpful. We used their brand new service to print our boarding passes for the trip to Shanghai. The location is excellent in Wan Chai and we were able to walk or use the metro to go almost anywhere. It was expensive but we were glad we treated ourselves to the luxury the Grand Hyatt had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “5 star experence !!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: I don't often write glowing reviews of hotels but this one was flawless. I was supposed to fly home on Saturday but my plane was full and I had to stay another night in Hong Kong. All this after I had been awake all of the previous night. I was literally sitting at the airport trying to find somewhere to stay when I found the Grand Hyatt on a search engine. I called them up told them what happened and they said “no problem we will organise a room for you head back to Hong Kong”. From the moment I showed up at the desk and gave my name everyone knew what had happened to me and was very sympathetic. They gave me a free upgrade to a Victoria Harbour room and expressed the check in process as they knew I was keen to sleep. I arrived in the room and needed laundry done as I had not planned on staying another night. It was 1 hour after the cut off time for normal service but they still came and got it and had returned it 6 hours later no extra charge. I went to sleep for a few hours then got up and went to the shop, when I returned 30 min later someone had come in and remade the bed! The room is massive by Hong Kong standards, the bathroom is bigger than most normal rooms in Hong Kong. The bathroom has a large bath and separate show with all the trimmings. The bedroom had a desk and chaser and still plenty of space. The bed was very comfortable and had a nice view. The location is slightly out of the way if you are thinking Wan Chai but if you are going to the convention centre it is literally attached to it. Although 5-10 min walk over the overpass and you will be in the centre of Lockhart road. Really don’t have a bad word to say about this place and I will definitely return to it next time I am Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “The correct treatment”
Reviews.Author: JimB_Toronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Hong Kong for a wedding. While weighing options for hotels, we decided to take the plunge and treat ourselves while in Hong Kong. The Grand Hyatt does not disappoint. We stayed on the club level, and while that was another option we debated (I don't actually drink), it was well worth it. Seems like it's own special hotel within the hotel. The staff take the time to get to know/recognize each guest and try to anticipate needs. The food was excellent, the rooms were clean and well maintained. The water pressure in the shower almost blew my face off - it was great! We didn't have a harbour view room, but being only one floor away from the club level allowed us to go and see the harbour light show when we were in the hotel. It is expensive, but well worth it if you want to treat yourself - and on this trip, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Marius71
Reviews.Content: My partner went for business and I tagged along for pleasure. The hotel is welcoming, serene, well equipped, comfortable and very well located. We had a run of the mill room overlooking the pool area and it was more than adequate for business and "tag along" purposes. The only shortcoming was we had to pay for wi-fi. It's a personal pet peeve of mine. Fantastic breakfast selection, really nice pool area with a variety of poolside food and drinks choices available. Only shortcoming here is that, at times, trying to get someone to take your order is quite a challenge. All in all, not the best hotel in Hong Kong but I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Di5227
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business but would normally stay on Kowloon side for leisure. Hotel, staff, location are fantastic. A must have is Club Lounge access with breakfast and hapPy hour with Moët on tap. Fabulous appetiserS make it difficult to leave room for dinner. A special mention for Scott who works in the lounge and who could not be more welcoming. A great asset to the hotel. Star ferry to Kowloon is less than 5 min walk and so easy. All in all an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It just gets better and better !”
Reviews.Author: janwholeboxndice
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel before however having just returned wanted to share my thoughts. This hotel really does tick all the boxes but what makes it stand out from the rest are the superb staff. The location , rooms , restaurants are all fabulous but the staff are beyond any expectation. Most of them have been there for some time and the hotel runs like a well oiled machine. I only go twice or three times a year however they always remember me ( by name ). They know my likes and dislikes. Simple things like always ensuring I have a DVD player in my room ( asked for once years ago ). Also I mentioned that I did not like the brand of the amenities in the room ( still very good ) and now I always get Aesop. This is just 2 examples of what I regard as above and beyond customer service. These are all the small things but this small attention to detail is what really makes this to be one of the best hotels in the world. I stay at many and The Grand Hyatt is one of the few places I get excited about visiting again. The location is terrific being right on the harbour. Well worth the extra money to get a harbour view as little beats Hong Kong harbour at night. The additional cost to stay in The Grand Club - best $$ you will spend. This is a wonderful experience and the service provided by Scott , Danny, Maggie , Stephanie and Meg - well what can I say - they are legends and I now regard them as friends and look forward to seeing them again. The restaurants on offer was seriously good. The steak house has to serve what was one of the best steaks I have ever had, all backed up with a extensive wine list. Grissini the Italian has the best angel hair pasta with crab and The Tiffin lounge pan fries Foie Gras to order. There is also a Japanese , Cafe , Champagne Bar , Roof Top Grill and all as good as each other. They are renovating next year so with brand new rooms and the best staff this will make The Grand Hyatt unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetlaggad
Reviews.Content: GH HK has been around for quite some time and has a good and consictent service level . Rooms are a bit worn out and on the small side compared with other top hotels in HK . You can stay at the MO for the same price in a renovated and larger room. Lobby is impressive , the bar ok , the new steak house really with a visit. Also would recommend to stay at a club floor as the top floor club lounge has very good service , perfect for breakfast and after work drinks.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, with a service level that you would expect for this price range and this na,e”
Reviews.Author: CultureChaser1234
Reviews.Content: Good location, excellent service, very good food in the restaurants. This is one of my favourite hotels in Hong Kong. The rooms are lovely (although views are hard to come by) and the pool is good. The spa, while naturally pricey, has good services and layout. The gym is well set up and in good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional "boutique" service at the Grand Dame”
Reviews.Author: Georges F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from an experience of a lifetime, with the opportunity to attend a wedding in Hong Kong held at the Grand Hyatt Hotel. Our wedding party knew of our interests and preferences for boutique hotels but encouraged us to stay at the Grand Club within the Grand Hyatt, assuring us we would be in for a real treat - this was an understatement. The staff and service were of the highest standards including all the special touches one comes to associate with only boutique style hotels these days. The Grand Club offered this and more with its added benefit to reside within the grandeur of the broader Grand Hyatt. We truly experienced the best of both worlds, not to mention the breath-taking harbor views of this dynamic city. Our stay was a truly memorable and lasting pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Personal favourite in HK”
Reviews.Author: milehighj
Reviews.Content: This is my personal favourite hotel in HK for its familiarity and unpretentious good service. In particular, the Grand Club lounge is one of the best club floors in existence anywhere - great venue for business or social meetings, very warm service, great F&B spread and views. The rooms are not the newest, nor is the location the most convenient (in my opinion, I would prefer Central to Wanchai), but I am more than happy to come back on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid stay”
Reviews.Author: pdoma
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week around feb 2011 in one of the grand club harbour view rooms. Our stay, especially with our infant was a very comfortable one. we had great time at club lounge, which took care for our special vegetarian needs. We were smartly complemented with spa facilities in an episode when the bathtub shower temporarily ran down. The harbour view from the room was excellent. Hygiene and all other services were grand!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, attentive staff, we could move in”
Reviews.Author: dangrad
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here with spouse on holiday. Welcomed by Lily at the front desk. Had city view king room, but she offered us a harbour-view double room. We accepted it. Lily showed us to our room and offered to show us all the features of the room but we declined her assistance. She was most friendly and welcoming. We were able to slide the beds together to make a large king bed so it was brilliant. View from room was fantastic, looking over towards Central and across to Kowloon. There is the reclamation project/construction going on and there is some noise (we were on 17th floor) but it wasn't bad. Lots of comforts in the room and lots of nice artworks (glass, etc). tea/coffee making facility. Large bathroom with all the comforts. Large separate tub and shower. Beds were comfy. Towels were large and soft. It was two days well-spent. Didn't eat in any of the hotel's restaurants or use the pool/gym. Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: amorphos
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, luxurious without being stuffy. Clean and comfortable, very spacious as well. Only reason why it got 4 star is because I dont like it's location very much - a 8-10minute walk to the nearest MTR and nothing much in it's vicinity (i.e. shops, restaurants) until you get closer to the MTR station. Guess if you're stayin in a place like this they expect you to be able to afford the cab!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Just tired and not so "Grand"”
Reviews.Author: Justbobhrh
Reviews.Content: Horribly expensive (I was charged 650AUD per night for a room that looked over a building site) for what it is. If the hotel had been refurbished and didnt feel so tired then I wouldn't feel like I was paying through the nose. The rooms are spacious but old. I dont think this hotel qualifies as 5 star based on the outdated decor and rooms. Sure the service is exemplary but you expect that from a "Grand Hyatt". For example, the hotel was able to have a tailor sent to my room within the hour to have a black tie suit ready for a function. My colleague had one of the Japanese styled rooms on Level 11 which looked fantastic. If I had to stay here again then I would try one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShionKai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early April towards the end of our trip to Hong Kong. As a Hyatt fan, I chose this place over Intercon, Peninsula etc. The hotel itself was great with excellent staff on hand to help us. The design of the hotel lobby was very elegant and the check-in process was very fast. We had the Harbour view room which was awesome except for the construction going on outside our window. The room was pretty big and the bed was very comfy. The weather wasn't too great during that time but we still managed to see some great views of Kowloon from our room. The bathroom looked amazing and was so big. Too bad they didn't have bidets like Park Hyatt. The pool was great too although we didn't spend too much time there. Location would probably be the only downside to this hotel since nothing is really in walking distance except for the Kowloon ferry terminal. However, this wasn't a big issue as we cabbed it to Central or Causeway bay. Definitely a place to try especially if you are going to the convention centre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: physioT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to attend a wedding and we were not disappointed. It is a large hotel, with good views of the harbor, but there is a lot of construction work around, so don't be surprised if there is a construction site in view as well. The rooms are large by Hong Kong standards, with marble adorned bathrooms, and very comfy King beds. They provided a child's bed for free and I was very happy with that. The location is good but we did get stuck in a terrible traffic jam near the entrance to the hotel. Ie. it took about 15 mins to move 500m! I guess that's HK for you. I would love to come back to this hotel but it is probably a bit expensive for longer stays. I will have to keep an eye out for specials!,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, amazing staff, delicious food! Perfect :)”
Reviews.Author: Goda M
Reviews.Content: I spent about ten days at the Grand Hyatt this past January. From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I had an amazing experience. Our room was booked by a frequent guest so I know we got tip top service. Upon entering my room I was greeted with a hand written welcome note, a bottle of wine and fresh fruit. The room itself had a harbor view, was ultra spacious and the bed was delightful. Every night starting around 5:30 we would head up to the club lounge and got to enjoy appetizers and free happy hour. The staff was always smiling and knew our names. I was truly amazed! Overall, the hotel is amazing. Every guest is treated like a VIP. I highly recommend it and can not wait to go back. Great location too! I can gush about this place for forever! Go, stay and enjoy. :)

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled”
Reviews.Author: Boomhongkong
Reviews.Content: We have just completed the trip of our lifetime, for our lifetime together. Please let me explain. We chose The Grand Hyatt, Hong Kong as the venue for our wedding as we wanted a destination that a very few of our guests had experienced. I tend to express very little sentiment and emotion ( unfortunately a male trait ) but this hotel brought me to the brink of tears. The attention to detail from our hosts at the Grand Club ( Jake Mc Hugh and his team ares absolute genius in human nature and client service and understanding ) will forever be appreciated. All of our guests were greeted with the most absolute professional and welcoming arms. ( This was not a exclusive attitude, we witnessed this every moment of every day, for every guest) I cannot thank you enough for everything. We will all remember this as a trip " for our lifetime" David Ps Even room service and concierge deserve a ten out of ten, always outstanding!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service and truly a world-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boilermaker21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong over Chinese New Year and I have never felt more welcomed and in awe of a hotel than during my stay at the Grand Hyatt. For the past few years I've stayed at countless hotels around the world both for work and leisure and this hotel is certainly the best one just for their service alone. During my two week stay there were countless instances where the staff went above and beyond to do things for me and it astonished me of their attention to detail. For instance, I met Jake for the first time on the pool deck while enjoying a couple cigars with my Dad and one of his business associates -- during our chat we were talking about a book and the next time I returned to my room there was a little gift from the Grand Hyatt. After walking away from meeting me he sent someone out to buy the book we were talking about and had it delivered to my room with a personalized hand-written note. This was in addition to the welcome note I got from the manager of the entire hotel, the wine and fruit in my room upon arrival, and countless other follow-ups that made the experience incredible. First class service, awesome rooms and just an outstanding place to stay -- I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind!”
Reviews.Author: decoratedthat
Reviews.Content: My husband frequently stays at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong for business and I occasionally travel with him to visit. Besides this, we both travel extensively and feel there isn't a hotel anywhere with the personalized level of service that the staff at the Grand Hyatt provides. The attention paid to every little detail from every level of staff services is amazing! The location is perfect, in a quieter part of town but just a couple of blocks from the ferry to get to Kowloon and a short taxi to some of the fine restaurants on the Hong Kong side. This is of course, if you think you need to leave the premises to eat. Every restaurant on-site is top notch and exquisite. When you stay, definitely get club access to the Grand Club! The cocktails, hors d'oeuvres, view and staff make for a most impressive experience. Our son and his girlfriend who live in China joined us for a week's stay this past Chinese New Year. It was their first visit to Hong Kong but the staff at the Grand Hyatt treated them like they were valued repeat customers. We started out each day with breakfast at the Grand Club and always made sure we were back for Happy Hour at "The Club" (we called it pre-dinner because the appetizers were so amazing). We were lucky enough to secure a window seat for Chinese New Year and watched the fireworks in the Grand Club. We couldn't have had a better location. Truly an amazing experience and an amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Club Level Privileges are worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Royandrobinuk
Reviews.Content: The Club Lounge serves a great breakfast. The cocktail hour buffet is a good dinner substitute. The extra money you will pay for club privileges will be covered in no time by your use of the lounge. This hotel is a good hotel however it isn't new and is a bit on the worn side in terms of the rooms. It is a big and busy hotel. The rooms are very quiet and the service is very good. There are newer and more centrally located hotels in Hong Kong that will charge a comparable price and that are more convenient especially if you are using the MTR. However if you need to be near the Convention Centre this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Kathy B
Reviews.Content: Location is very good! Near to a lot of food places, drinking places, and quick access to my office in central.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: barrye09
Reviews.Content: Don"t pay much attention to the previous grumbles who say this hotel has small rooms or is in need of a makeover. This hotel is an experience in itself. The staff are nothing short of amazing, the rooms are spacious and comfortable. Admittedly I stayed on the club floor which I advise if you can afford it. Firstly, you get a complimentary breakfast which can be as little or as large as you want and that will last you all morning. You can also have free canapés and drinks from 530pm which can be a meal substitute so you save on paying for meals elsewhere. You can't fault the house keeping. My partner is an interior decorator with a very keen eye and he drew my attention to the way everything was lined up just right and every time we left the room, things were straightened. Amazing. I would stay here again next time. Who wants to be in the frenzy of Tsim Sha Shui when you can have the space and relative peace of Wan Chai. It's close to the ferry and a convenient undercover walk to the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here...”
Reviews.Author: businesstravel_12
Reviews.Content: Its like the home you wish was yours.. Restaurants are superb and the decor is very comfortable. The only downside is the location is slightly away from business district and main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age!”
Reviews.Author: Softlanding
Reviews.Content: When I first stayed at this property some 20+ years ago, it was among the best in Hong Kong. The only real thing going for it now is that the service and restaurants are generally good, but the rooms need a makeover - need to bigger and better fitted out. Given that my basic room was over USD 500 or so, that is a reasonable request.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: finnishbird
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here. Enjoyed my stay. Rooms are smaller than I expected. Pool is fantastic, and there is a great poolside sunday brunch. Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good as always but small room”
Reviews.Author: Eric060
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the concierge level and the lounge had plenty of food and champagne. It was usually crowded, but the nice staff compensated for that and made us feel very much welcomed even if we had to wait in line sometimes for a table. The room had all equipment to give us a nice stay but compared to other hotels we felt that the room was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: First time to HK and the Grand Hyatt. Overall high marks for the conveniences. Room was upscale and while the bathroom is beginning to look a little tired, the amenities were first rate. Spa and gym were great. The pool was secluded and nice. Did not eat at the restaurants, spent our time out and about. The concierge level service and especially the breakfast was worthwhile. Its a bit of hike to the Wan Chai MTR stop but we mostly used the public transport to get around and found it fun. Ferry ride was great. Taxis are cheap and often terrifying. Service was excellent except at the bar by the pool. Strange but true, while we were there the staff just seemed overwhelmed with the basics - and there we not a lot of people around. That being said, GH was solid and mostly attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: dickie98
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week whilst on business in HK. The hotel is in a good location in the Wan Chai district looking out over the harbour and Kowloon. The reception area is grand and the staff are friendly, polite and efficient. Check in was swift and baggage was delivered to the room quickly. The room was not huge but well planned and comfortable in pale wood, the harbour view rooms are just that, with a great view out to Kowloon. However, there is massive development of the waterfront going on and being on the harbour side means you can see, and hear, construction work from about 7am. The bathroom was a good size although rather old fashioned in marble and gold, clean and well stocked with soft towels and pleasant toiletries. The hotel restaurants that I tried were all very good though at hotel prices of course. Service throughout the hotel was impeccable and I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly memorable stay with exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: jhbkk
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Grand Hyatt, Hong Kong to celebrate a special birthday with family and friends. We were fortunate enough to book rooms in the grand club wing which gave us access to the grand club lounge for breakfast and evening cocktails. Our choice of hotel proved to be absolutely perfect, we were looked after superbly from check in to departure.In our party we had 3 "senior citizens", young people in their 20s and 30s and a 10 month old baby so our demands were indeed varied. The team at Grand Hyatt dealt with everything totally professionally and in a way that made us feel very much at home. On my actual birthday whilst drinking my pre dinner champagne courtesy of hyatt club I was presented with a magnificent birthday cake in the model of a bottle of champagne in an ice bucket, presented by Gordon the hotel's General Manager! At our request the cake was delivered to the outside restaurant where we we having dinner which was a lovely touch. Baby sitting was arranged with a lovely reliable lady who had worked for Grand Hyatt for many years. We booked a private guided city tour on a small coach via the hotel which suited us perfectly. A special mention for Jake, the Grand Club Manager, and his team who were so helpful throughout our stay. For anyone planning a special holiday in Hong Kong or indeed any stopover I recommend Grand Hyatt 100%

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in HKG!”
Reviews.Author: acr1960
Reviews.Content: This is by far and away the best hotel in HKG - great staff, great location, great view, great club .... what more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “"Best Birthday Ever!"”
Reviews.Author: cameramum
Reviews.Content: I have been blown away by the opulance and beauty of this hotel . From the moment we arrived we have been treated with courtesy and the most respectful attentiveness. From the fruit on our arrival to the birthday cake this evening courtesy of our concierge ,we couldn't ask for more. Everything is immaculate, our room is spacious and comfortable, the bathroom is equipped with everything we could need and the hotel is very conveniently situated for the Star Ferry port, MTR metro line and and main streets.The staff are very knowledgeable and able to provide maps, suggestions for places to visit, dinner reservations etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good all round business hotel”
Reviews.Author: BHBPCP
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a one week business trip. The bedroom was fine and clean with a relatively recent refresh. The bathroom was a little like a Sopranos bathroom with black marble and gold but still clean and good to use. The gym is pretty good with some free weights and a decent selection of different cardio machines. Breakfast buffet was great but then it should be at 300HKD so either have the breakfast included rate or "go for it" to try and get your monie worth. The swimming pool was closed for some maintenace but looked a decent pool to relax by or train in. Dont eat in the steak restaurant steak with pepper sauce good but the price will bring tears to your eyes. Am booked to come back in 2 weeks time and won't mind it a bit even though the newer hotels around are better.

Reviews.Title: “Still dependable...”
Reviews.Author: SpikeyDLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with a mix of business and leisure. Last stayed over 10 years ago and though the hotel looks largely the same it's been very well maintained. Had a harbour view room - fabulous view to both HK and Kowloon. Good size and very clean. Shower pressure wondrous! Room and eating prices what you'd expect from a 5 star hotel, but with really efficient and friendly service the value is pretty good on the whole. Conference facilities were very good, with excellent refreshments and buffet lunch. Only downside is no metro station close by, but with hk cabs so cheap this is no real problem. A great alternative to some of the glitzier new hotels on HK island.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Volatile75
Reviews.Content: Stayed in for 2 nights last weekend. Everything was perfect. Service with a smile, staff always willing to help, front desk made eye contact and was in high spirits, room was usual Hyatt, lobby restaurant staff was not hurrying us to eat, order or leave despite us coming at 11.55pm. Good job for a flawless operational excellence. Versus my previous entry on another premium hotel in HKG, I am convinced Grand Hyatt is No 1 in HKG.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience !!!”
Reviews.Author: AthensBlonde
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny to have a more expensive club room as their club lounge is the best I have seen and the view of Kowloon is superb!!! The food was pretty good too!!!! Endless glasses of champagne :-)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel compared to other options in the City”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneShepherdess
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positives: Very comfortable bed, polite service (although a little slow when moving room), good room service, very nice pool area and outdoor dining area (not that I used it given the weather at this time of year). Good Chinese restaurant. Helpful concierge. Sadly there are more negatives that positives: The location is poor unless you are going to the exhibition centre - cut off and nothing to walk directly to and quickly to from the hotel. And it is very busy when there are exhibitions so taxis are not always ideal from this location. Hotel rooms noisy - it seems you can hear the bathroom above whenever the shower is used. On my second stay in a fortnight I was allocated a room with an adjoining door when I had specifically requested a quiet room (and I had been moved on my previous stay just over a week before because of noise from above) - it was really noisy with the paper thin adjoining door and I had to move. They upgraded me which was nice, and gave me a complimentary bottle of wine which was also a nice touch. But I did spend an hour moving room and even when I had moved the building site opposite was also quite noisy and this is just across from the hotel and they work long hours. And I had the noise from the bathroom again - clearly just a problem with the hotel. The hotel being next to the conference centre seems very impersonal - large public spaces and not in my opinion a great place to be staying on your own on business, partly because of the location. They charge a steep HKD 160 per day flat rate to access the internet so even if you need to send just one email you end up being charged for a full day. Given the room rates this just seems inappropriate to say the least. The hotel was convenient for work but i would not want to stay here again if I have a choice due to the location and the noise. I'd rather have to taxi to work and get up earlier than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “not the same”
Reviews.Author: CLAUDE B
Reviews.Content: Still one of the best in hongkong but the management is getting sloppy. The first time we came to the Grand Hyatt Hongkong, we were entitled to an automatic upgrade as Hyatt gold passport guests. and were led to a suite overlooking the harbour through a full window panel. But Hongkong has changed, the friendliness has gone. You must find your own way to your room, there is no more upgrade and the request for such, was flatly denied. The suites must probably be kept vacant for apparatchiks from Beijing. Moreover I found my bill charged for using a MCI telephone card, which seasoned travelers mostly use just for the prevention of hotels inflating one's call charges. Their telephone system has been configured to detect the codes of charge cards.That's when you know this is China.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, room design and club floor”
Reviews.Author: OlgaSergienko
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a bit off the main road but there is always a line of taxis awaiting to pick the guests up. Just bear in mind that in rush hours it could be better to get down 10 minutes in advance to wait for your turn. The rooms are very well ecorated, the design is calm and sophisticated. Maarble bathrooms are very luxurious and sexy. There are special spa suites and they are more expensive than regular rooms but a very unusual experience. They feature round japanese style baths and would appeal to zen lovers. The outside pool is really big and nice. The club floor offers a great variety for breakfast and through out the day including 5 pm drinks - all of superb quality Really worth the money

Reviews.Title: “exellent”
Reviews.Author: pablo g
Reviews.Content: I liked the food, the location, the gym, the rooms!!spot on!!

Reviews.Title: “Need of a reno”
Reviews.Author: Consultbishop
Reviews.Content: Main lobby areas are very nice and location is good if you are using the convention centre. Rooms really need a redo as they are quite dated. The internet connection is quite poor in the rooms, both wi-fi and LAN cable. Gym was well equipped and lots of free weights as well as machines. When the new Harbour front is complete, this hotel will find itself in a great location. If you don't need to be at HKCEC, HK has plenty better options for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...but starting to show signs of age”
Reviews.Author: OzCol1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and very much enjoyed my stay. It is definitely a grand hotel, with spacious public areas and excellent staff. Rooms were smallish but very comfortable, though starting to age. The amazing harbour view I had made up for that. What I liked: - harbour view - excellent service - comfortable rooms - use of facilities in neighbouring club (tennis etc) What I didn't like: - Rooms a litlte bit old. Parts of my taps in the bathroom kept falling off! - No ipod player (well, at least not in my room) - Lobby restaurant was very overpriced and had a terrible view of construction(which is not the hotel's fault) - Location. It is nicely placed in between causeway bay and central but yet a bit inconveniently out of the way from anything unless you are having a conference. It is half way between two MTR stations though neither is that far or close. Thankfully its not a big deal as its a cheap taxi ride to Central.

Reviews.Title: “good stay, ok food”
Reviews.Author: Zhiwei T
Reviews.Content: stay, service good. staff all very friendly food... not as good as taiwan's food location... not good

Reviews.Title: “Quite possibly the most amazing hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: cxw44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights for leisure last summer, and it was outstanding. The Regency Club service, food, drinks, and views are TO DIE FOR. The spread was always plentiful, and the staff couldn't help fast enough. The food in the club was enough to eat for dinner, and the breakfast filled me up through lunch, so I barely ended up paying for any food. The staff was also very helpful in recommending places to see in the city. The rooms themselves aren't huge by any standard, but perfectly adequate. I think the bathrooms are nearing the end of their lifespan for a hotel of this caliber, but I hardly spent any time there so it wasn't a deterrent for me. The room seemed to have everything I needed, including a power adapter (which Hyatt is good about), so no complaints there. I also liked the overall feel of the rooms and the corridors...cozy corridors but lots of windows in the room to create a light yet comfortable feel. The pool and bar surrounding it were also a treat. To be at the pool, look up at skyscrapers, and out onto the harbor was quite nice. Additionally, the pool at night with the bar is spectacular, albeit expensive. I highly recommend checking it out. Overall I fell in love with the hotel and the city alike. I actually had a stopover in Hong Kong this year on my way to Bali just in hopes of staying at the hotel. If you get the chance, STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a competitive hotel market”
Reviews.Author: ariellek_bj
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong offers numerous hotels at 4 to 5 star levels, but this 5-star hotel deserves its reputation and its constant near-full occupancy. The location is convenient to business travellers and vacationers alike. The building itself is quite old but most of the room have been refurbished in recent years. I particularly enjoyed the rooftop swimming pool, but was also impressed by the service of the staff. I was working on my laptop computer at the cafe at the lobby while enjoying coffee and some cakes, but due to an urgent business matter I had to leave that table and attend to something at the business centre. The staff was kind enough to keep watch of my computer even though I had to be away for 15-20 minutes. It's a small thing but nonetheless this small kindness made my stay smoother and more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: BobG499
Reviews.Content: Stayed 13 days before and after New Year in a harbour view room. Amazing views, average size rooms but very comfortable with practical layout and storage, very good bed, nice bathroom, top quality restaurants, very quiet. The staff were truly outstanding - the hospitality team actually went shopping to find non-allergenic soaps that would not irritate my wife. If you don't mind a 5-10 minute walk you have easy access to bus, tram, the Star Ferry and subway plus taxi fares in HK are very affordable. We would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IvorynGold
Reviews.Content: I was on business trip to Hong Kong. Grand Hyatt Hong Kong is a good hotel with friendly hotel staff and good bed. The room is okay, clean, and I could view the famous Victoria Harbour from my hotel room. It is not located near the train station. You have to move around the city by taxi. Well, the taxi fare in Hong Kong is cheap compared to Singapore. Overall, I am satisfied and happy with Grand Hyatt Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Josaiah
Reviews.Content: Good hotel but a bit away from business. Have to take a cab. Did not see any walking path to Central. Royal Rooms. Harbour view is very nice. Breakfast is ok but not bad..... Staff are courteous room is well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with unobstructed views”
Reviews.Author: joanne7575
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited HK for a week and stayed at three hotels, two on points and the Peninsula where we paid. We expected the Pen to be the best but were surprised that both of the other hotels offered more in the way of amenities and comfort and more desirable locations. Initially we had planned to stay at the Hyatt in Tsim Sha Tsui but having gone over to the Kowloon side for dinner we did not like the ambience so much...or the pollution...so we asked Hyatt Gold Passport if we could move to the Grand Hyatt and they made it very easy for us. We were more than pleased with our room and the view, the shower was amazing, free internet was available and the lounge was outstanding. This is a first class hotel, perhaps a little inconvenient for tourists but not overly so. You can get to Central for about $3 USD in a taxi and from there everything is easy. A good experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “WOW service, location”
Reviews.Author: NathalieGarino
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Hong Kong touring around and decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt as our expectations of this hotel would have to be good. It turned out that the whole experience was WOW. From checkin in to checkin out, the entire staff took fabulous care for us. My partner had hurt his foot during our vacation, the hotel had organized a doctor's appointment (2 min away from the hotel), taxi to take us and even sent the concierge to the doctor's room while we were waiting to see if we were alright! The room was exceptionally clean and beautiful, we had an amazing view of the harbor which made it even more special. The room was equipped with everything needed (adaptors, hair dryer, slippers, bathrobe and all the toiletry needed), a basket of fresh fruit was delivered to our room every single morning with the local and international papers. The concierge service was better than the ones of a tour operator, we were given maps with tips and ideas of things and places to see. Breakfast in the morning was delicious and catered for all cultures. Location is ideal as walking distance to the subway station, Tram, Pier, all the major shopping centers etc. We recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Hong Kong may it be for holidays, conference etc. A true gem at reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: travel_hyd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt with children over Christmas and the experience was wonderful. Great food, awesome service and wonderful hospitality. The rooms can be a bit cramped though. The festive season added to the charm of the place, what with the huge christmas tree, the christmas specialities in the bakery, ...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Visit”
Reviews.Author: powersdun
Reviews.Content: We stayed on this property 1-5 Dec. A bit out of the way, and more suited for business travelers, we would go back again. Staff was as good as it gets, and prompt with any rerquest. I've read other reviews which thought the rooms were small. Ours was just fine. We did get a harbor view, and maybe that was the difference, but what a beautiful look at night. We waited to long to get in on the Club floors, fully booked, but other than a few drinks don't know what we missed. Look forward to a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Grand for business, not first choice for holidays...”
Reviews.Author: Froggystyle
Reviews.Content: I'd be very happy staying here for business but I wouldn't stay here on holidays again. If you like to explore by foot and public transport, the hotel is awkwardly situated and I'd consider staying in a hotel closer to Central or Causeway Bay where the action is more on the doorstep. The hotel itself is excellent, the rooms (and particularly the beds) are super-comfortable and the service was impeccable but this can be expected for the price paid of course (though free wi-fi wouldn't hurt would it?).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but not 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: MONYLINE
Reviews.Content: A bit tired despite a beautiful pool and a wide variety of restaurants. Rooms are a bit dated. Compared to other 5 Star properties I have stayed at (Conrad, Mandarian Oriental), this Hotel just doesnt come close.
