Service in the bar--the bartender was distracted with a 20 minute phone conversation (it wasnt personal but someone was annoying her) and the waitress in the Sushi restaurant was too panicked---running around the entire time. Short staffed? Not sure but both were annoying and would never happen at the Conrad or Mandarian. So, not a train wreck, definitely a nice hotel but not the levels of the 5 star properties of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A grand hoteln withnnot grand bedrooms.”
Reviews.Author: Ferraguso
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of what anyone can expect of such a Gran Hyatt. It has an excellent location, an amazing lobby, perfect service, the swiming pool is really a beautiful place in the hotel. The bathrooms are some of the most amazings i have ever see in a hotel. It is sad that the bedrooms do not keep the same grandiosity. This is a very...very expensive hotel, and the rooms do not look nice, the bedrooms actuálly look old and tired. The beds are fantastic, but the rooms are small and with not a nice decoration like the rest of the hotel. They really have to do something about it. My experience overall was good, I think thst those who work there do an excellent job. Because the rooms I may prefer to stay in a diferent hotel in my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: mdehaan
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely 5-star hotel. I had a great view and an excellent stay. I could find no fault in my four night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spring for the grand harbour view room”
Reviews.Author: taotei
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms per two nights - one I booked with points - which was a garden view on the club floor. Smallish, but good for HKG and a gorgeous bathroom. The linens were crisp and the bed comfortable. The view is nothing to speak of - just the building next door. The grand harbour view room was spectacular - floor to ceiling windows with a view of central and cross the bay to Kowloon. The room itself was roomier, with a separate desk, walk in closet, and plenty of space overall. The club lounge is gorgeous, and the staff is super attentive - breakfast had ample choice, fresh fruits, dim sum, eggs and lots a pastries. The coffee is also excellent. In the evenings guests gather for complimentary cocktails - and champagne is the libation of choice - corks popping jubilantly. The buffet is also quite nice, I especially enjoyed the parma ham on fresh fig with basil. It is not inexpensive, airport transfers were hk$1030 each way, and the room rates made me sweat just a little.

Reviews.Title: “Good~but need to pay for internet!”
Reviews.Author: hui h
Reviews.Content: Good services, comfortable room and bed. Quite convenient as taxi and shuttles are available under the hotel. The thing I dislike most is need to pay for internet!

Reviews.Title: “one word: Wow”
Reviews.Author: knowmyhotels
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt Hong Kong is a flagship property under the Hyatt brand for a reason - it's awesome! As a Hyatt Diamond member, I was upgraded to the Grand Floor and got a beautiful room with a killer harbor view, so great that I didn't want to leave. The complementary Welcome Amenity for Diamond member was very generous: a bottle of nice red wine, box of chocolate and a nice top-quality fruit basket. The room was modern, not overly chic, clean and beautifully appointed. Perhaps it was my upgrade to the Grand Floor, but the room size is surprisingly large for a city like HK. Bed was super comfortable. Service at this hotel was also wonderful. The staff was polite and effiicient and not a bit of attitude like you may get from Europe and America. The Grand Club Lounge is also another highlight at this hotel. The breakfast food spread consists fo a good mixture of east and west items and are absolutely top-end quality. Among them, a few common dimsum items that were very yummy (I am Chinese and know my dimsums). Competition for dimsum in HK is fierce and this place does not disappoint in anyway. Afternoon service was equally impressive - a good spread of appetitizer and sweets that just make you want to go back for more. Waiting staff was polite and attentative and there wasn't any kids running around during my visit, so it was a wonderful atmopshere with a panoramic view to boot. All in one, it was a wonderful top-rated hotel and a truly memorable experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “Best 5 star for the money”
Reviews.Author: BostonBP
Reviews.Content: I have tried all the 5 star hotels in Hong Kong. And the Grand Hyatt is without a doubt the best for the money. the last 3 times I have been upgraded to a suite with harbor view at no charge. The Chinese and steak house are very good. The others are so so. So save your money and go there. Great view, good food and great location. BP

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and View”
Reviews.Author: ssbalcis
Reviews.Content: This hotel has fantastic views to the city and convinient location. The best is to be able to walk to the Ferry Station in two minutes.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel, but no cigar.”
Reviews.Author: drivervet
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt hotel on Hong Kong Island feels a little tired and dated. The staff are friendly and helpful, but the rooms are small, chintzy and dated. It also lacks soul as a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Respit in Elegance”
Reviews.Author: SoloSlowTouring
Reviews.Content: After spending a month in a 3-star hotel in Chennai, India, I was exhausted and ready for a little pampering. Knowing nothing of Hong Kong and having no patience for finding that perfect little Chinese owned hotel, I opted for the Grand Hyatt on Victoria Harbour. As soon as the bellman opened the door, I knew I had made the right decision. The room just oozed pampering...the view of the Harbour was never ending, the crisp white bed looked like it was made to rest my tired soul, as well as body, the simple Asian design helped calm my cluttered mind. The bathroom was exquisite, with a deep tub and shower. I found myself only taking baths, the tub was so wonderful. Of course, I got out of each bath and into the thick terry robe and slippers provided for me. I really did not even want to leave the room, but did. I saw Kowloon and road the trolley in the old shoreline area of Hong Kong, snapping pictures without having to exert the energy I did not have. Each time, I could take the public transportation back to my stop and walk the short blocks through the winding walkways between buildings, which is so typical of Hong Kong high rises, to the entrance of my hotel. Each time I was graced by outside staff who greeted me with professional friendliness and kindness. I could walk into the gorgeous lobby and enjoy just the beautiful design that was my living room for my short stay. But it was wonderful to also have jazz playing on the mezzanine, welcoming me with a relaxing ambiance. One evening I stopped and sat for a time listening to the great pianist and four-part combo. If I had not been so tired, I would have ordered a drink and appetizer and settled in for the night.. It is expensive, but for a short stay it is well worth the money as you are assured to see much of what you wish, water or city, right from your hotel window. If you are ready to partake in the excitement that is special to Hong Kong, then select the city-side of the hotel. If you are more inclined to need rest, as I was, then the Harbour side is perfect. Waking to the boats and ships beginning to move across the water and resting with the hues of sunset still touching the seascape, was a great treat. I also got a fruit plate each day, which was the perfect ending for my busy couple of days in the two cities. With bottled water provided, I did not even need to grace the bar. I definitely recommend this hotel as a place for one or two or a group of friends. And certainly, stay as long as your money will allow!

Reviews.Title: “Off beat location, hard to navigate layout, poor service, expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Dallas2711
Reviews.Content: Unhelpful concierge and front desk staff. Very expensive. Rooms a bit small. Slightly old fashioned.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Stalwart”
Reviews.Author: DuffnGuff
Reviews.Content: A good hotel for either business or pleasure with nice rooms although the bathrooms look a little tired now. Good choice of restaurants and a cracking bar make for a good all round experience. Could do with a quicker check in process but the rest of the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: Edward-A A
Reviews.Content: Stay here for one night with an awaken package. Have been assigned a room with ceiling-to-floor window and a view to garden/swimming pool. The room is of classical style with photos of Hong Kong in the past. The design and the facilities inside the room make you feel at home and does not feel that it is small. The services provided are awesome (good and tasty breakfast, well-equipped and modern fitness facilities, and more than 40 TV channels + pay-on-demand videos). The main drawback is similar to that in Hyatt Regency ShaTin - what's the point of having a counter for Platinum and Diamond Members but no one is able to serve?

Reviews.Title: “Meets (most) High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: fishskis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Grand Hyatt several times over the last few years, and it continually meets the high expectations I have for a Hong kong luxury hotel. The hotel is very grand and Marble-y; not my preferred design style, but it works here. And though I do not love huge hotels, it is rather large; but the service remains extraordinary. I would place this hotel half a notch below the top hotels such as The Pen or The Mandarin or The Four Seasons. The rooms are not quite as nice as the others mentioned, can be a little smaller, and can be slightly worn. I am not sure if they have started updating their rooms, but it might be about time to do so. If the price is close, I would go for the other choices, but if not, you will not go wrong at The Grand Hyatt. Also, occasionally there are some good promotions with Amex Platinum. Some will like its Wanchai location for the convenient nightlife and fairly central location, others may find Wanchai a bit sleazy. The breakfast buffet is excellent, as is the service throughout the hotel. Room service is very good, and the the Chinese restaurant is very good as well, though maybe not quite up to its excellent reputation. You could do a lot worse than to be sitting in your Harborview room looking out towards Kowloon enjoying one of the most vibrant cities in the world. Yes, spring for the Harborview, it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: jdmckay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt, and we were very satisfied with our stay. We used points for three nights stay. Although we didn't get a room with a view, we still enjoyed our stay. Each day we were given a bowl of fresh fruit. The marble bathroom with a VERY powerful shower was awesome. The location is convenient to the very efficient MTR. You just follow the above ground walkway and you're there in three blocks. We also took the tram and found that to be quite the experience. We didn't take advantage of the buffet out by the pool on Sunday, but it looked awesome, and would advise no matter the price. Even though it looks off the beaten path, we found the MTR to make it easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you like the area”
Reviews.Author: travelfiend_30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch and lives up to its name. Rooms are large, views are spectacular and beds are comfy. Everything is clean, service is good and wifi is included in the price. Breakfast buffet is awesome, though a bit overpriced at around HK$300. I also tried the Chinese restaurant (1 Harbor Road or something like that) and was disappointed. Note that the hotel is very comfortable if you are attending a conference but if you are looking to also go out and have a good time on the town, this is not a great area. It is located in Wan Chai, which is essentially the somewhat seedy red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for What You Get”
Reviews.Author: roxipod
Reviews.Content: Not cheap, but well worth the money, Grand Hyatt HK is a fantastic hotel and hands-down my choice in HK. Location, views, service, efficiency of check-in and service all get highest rating. Near conference centre and you can easily get anywhere by taxi, bus, mini-bus or nearby ferry as it's in WanChai not in the middle of all of the 'buzz'.

Reviews.Title: “Quality sevice /rooms getting old”
Reviews.Author: jnr641802
Reviews.Content: Stayed Oct 2011 Harbour view room.Last stayed in this hotel when the hotel was newish in 1992.The Harbour views were superb then, sadly the harbour has shrunk and some of the views are now overlooking a building site,that's progress I suppose...Otherwise the service is as good as it gets anywhere and the location is superb ( Kowloon ferry just to the right of the hotel ,10 mins walk). pros : The very best service possible from all staff,greeted and taken from hotel car straight to my hotel room for checkin.Ignoring building works the view is still good.Bed far too soft (for me).Good sized pool area (especially for Hong Kong ...) although the sun is blocked out by other skyscrapers for much of the day and the pool can be chilly .Poolside dinner buffet was very very expensive but superb ,and there's plenty of other eating options in the hotel but again at a price. cons : If you are not on an expense account (most other guests are I would venture) It is a very expensive hotel but this is Hong Kong island and all 5 star hotels are expensive here.The rooms as others have mentioned are now looking their age and stains on furnishings/chips on furniture etc are on quite a few surfaces.Rooms are not large but adequate.As mentioned the restaurants/bars are very expensive but obviously there are limitless cheaper alternatives outside the hotel. The Hotel is mostly geared towards business travellers and is generally rock solid in quality.I've been coming to Hong Kong regularly since the 1970's but next time I'll do what I always said I would not do and stay in Kowloon for a change,as I'm paying the hotel bills nowadays......

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Sue303506
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located, the view is really fantastic.well connected to conference center and ferry , and to all the nice shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: CR88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Club Floor room. Excellent amenities and service. Hotel staff is very courteous and friendly and many try to remember your name, even if you are there for a short period. Hotel is very clean and secure. Rooms are laid out well with all conveniences. Location, although close to Wanchai, is a little too far to walk to neighboring areas; usually you will end up taking a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: tokyolady
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room with a harbor view and we received a view of the park. You had to crane your neck to the right in order to get a view of the actual harbor. We reserved a car pick up/drop off. They were punctual and well-appointed luxury vehicles. The hotel itself is not for tourists. It is a business hotel and it has a rushed, business-like feel to it. Due to its close proximity to the convention centre, there are mostly business people staying at this hotel during the week. Our daily brunch felt rushed (it finished at 10 am). Our greeters always walked quickly, whisking us to our table. The waiters/waitresses often took or tried to take our plates before we finished and what is with the constant banging of plates? There is no presentation in the way that plates and cutlery are laid down or taken away. They do it very aggressively and loudly, it was quite shocking actually. It felt like a diner and not a 5 star hotel. Our rooms were quiet and clean though, the bathroom was beautiful indeed. But again, I wouldn't stay here as a tourist, only on business. Finally, I am a frequent member...why wasn't I put in a club room?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - again!”
Reviews.Author: Gibbsy14
Reviews.Content: Great room, great breakfast, pricy champagne lounge, but lovely spa and outdoor bar.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property with harbour views”
Reviews.Author: obrij1
Reviews.Content: Really a top end location and great rooms for the price. Easy to gt to anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Personal Service, Good Wanchai Location”
Reviews.Author: Robert N
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong because of its location: it is attached to the Convention Center, where I was scheduled to teach at a trade show/convention for the maritime industry. I could have stayed at a nearby hotel but chose the GH because of my experience at the GH Sao Paulo, where I met Hyatt's Miss Winnie Lee, who was flown by the company from the GHHK to Sao Paulo to help with the grand opening of that hotel. She was obviously very good at her temporary job in Sao Paulo, so I (correctly) assumed she would have her home hotel running with equal competence. I had reserved a club-level room and a hotel car to pick me up at the airport, which went smoothly. I was quite surprised to find Miss Lee waiting to greet me upon stepping out of the car at the hotel; I found out later that she had come in on her day off to do so. That's called attention to duty. She showed me to my stylish room with a great view of the harbor and explained how to find and work everything (these rooms are modern). The room was very clean and the bathroom luxurious with a dandy shower. The passageways are quiet and nicely lit with soft lighting and adorned with decorations. If you need or want to be in Wanchai, the Grand Hyatt is a very good choice. Be sure to spend some time wandering around Wanchai, especially upper Wanchai, to get a sense of the real Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beanui
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay and thoroughly enjoyed the Grand Hyatt. Service was excellent, even the bell boys were cheerfully helpful when they helped give our taxi instructions. We were in a habour view executive room on the 29th floor. The view was literally to-die-for! The room itself was comfortable, although a tad bit small with 2 single beds instead of the usual 2 queens that I am more used to in a double room. The bathroom however was huge and all the amenities generously replenished daily. House keeping even left extra bottles of water daily after I requested for an extra bottle one evening. Front desk staff on the executive floor were great. They organised dinner reservations at busy restaurants, even helping me get reviews of the restaurants I was interested in prior to doing the table bookings. Location wise, the hyatt is 15min walk to Pacific place and all it's shops and a 5min walk to the star ferry terminal. It is of course also conveniently situated next to the convention centre. taxis are cheap and plentiful in HK, so we just cabbed it anywhere else. It is a 5min cab ride to the Hong Kong Terminal in central for the Airport Express, which is probably the most dependable way to and from the airport as traffic can occationally be a problem. In all, a great hotel, good location and excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: floridavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 4 days in October. It was a marvelous experience. The staff were so kind and efficient. The room was luxurious and the food fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel For Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: hog4oc
Reviews.Content: Stay there for three days for the Hong Kong Electronics shows, love this property and will be back next time visiting HK. Pro: 1 min walk to convention center Excellent facility and good service Club level breakfast and cocktail clean and quite - no loud mainland Chinese there. 50 meter long swimming pool SPA service top rated Nice harbor view room Con: None

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Steraimo
Reviews.Content: have stayed here for 3 days and the staff was amazing, very kind and thoughtful. They remembered my name and made me feel like a guest in a boutique hotel. Club floor is amazing with a lovely view on the harbour. Location is very convenient as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Grand Hyatt in Asia - Suite Stay”
Reviews.Author: splatnz
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times now and it is without question of all the Grand Hyatt's in Asia my favourite. Likes - Amazing service, from reservations to room service to the staff in the Club room - Very nice big pool area - Good modern gym - Quality food and drinks in Club Room - June Jacobs toiletries Dislikes - A little out of the way. 10min walk to MTR or take a taxi. Overall it's a great hotel but it's really the service that makes it a stand out for me. Staff in the Club Room remember your name between visits and greet you like an old friend. The Front Desk staff are friendly and efficient and work hard to make each stay special. Will definitely continue to stay here on future visits to HK.

Reviews.Title: “My Home away from Home and simply the best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janwholeboxndice
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Grand Hyatt Hong Kong for many years and whilst newer and larger hotels have opened I would not move any where else. What started as a location choice has now become my only choice. To this day when I arrive the staff remember my name and also my preferences. I always get a DVD player in my room. I am thoroughly spoiled by wonderful staff. The rooms are wonderful and beds are TDF ( to die for ). Its location is close to the Star Ferry and also 2 mins walk to the convention center. Frederick Wong who is the Resident Manager , is a true hotelier and leads his team with a level of professionalism seldom seem today - efficient and friendly. The food choices in the many restaurant options are wonderful and the Crab Linguini is wonderful. On top of this the gym is state of the art and if you are like me and find it a tad boring the machines all have individual entertainment units so you can spend your time on the treadmill etc catching up on world news or watching that movie you never seem to have time to watch. On top of this the spa is wonderful and just what is needed after a long day at the trade show or shopping, Nothing is a problem for the staff whether you are a first time visitor or like me a repeat offender,

Reviews.Title: “Definitely happy with our choice of hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugtoo
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong and could not have been happier with our stay there. We had a beautiful suite on the 17th floor and access to the Club floor. The staff on the Club floor are amazing! They are attentive, polite and helpful. The view is possibly the best in Hong Kong. The rooms are comfortable. I love the bathrooms....big shower and bathtub. We sampled two of the restaurants - the chinese one and the one on the ground floor (can't remember either name) but both were good and reasonably priced for a hotel restaurant. I think one of the reasons I like this hotel so much is you are away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to enjoy it. Public transport is very close (train and ferry) and taxis are SO cheap (about 1/10th the cost of the price in Sydney)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with some nice touches”
Reviews.Author: alice1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January for a friend's birthday trip. The hotel was in a great location near the harbour - a short walk to Wan Chai just across the footbridge. It was close to some great restaurants, walking distance to shopping areas if you're fairly active and close enough to the tram to get around the rest of the island. The great thing about this hotel was the attention to detail - there were two electrical adapters in the room without having to ask - something small, but essential when travelling from overseas - each day the bathroom amenities were filled up - for some reason I needed a nail file every day and the great thing was that it was replaced daily. I was lucky enough to be staying with a party of about a dozen people sharing about six or seven rooms on different floors and different locations of the hotel so I got to see a range of rooms. They all had harbour views - I'll upload pictures - one friend had a 1bed suite, that was large with a massive king bed - maybe bigger. There was a large pool and a fairly decently equipped gym, several treadmills and cross trainers as well as a variety of weights machines. I'm not sure too much about the price - I didn't pay - lucky me - but I know it was expensive, but the feel of the hotel was very secure and safe. Add to that the convenient location, the service from the staff and of course looking out at the beautiful harbour from the room - it would definitely be somewhere I'd be looking to stay the next time I go to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable, excelent, unforgetable”
Reviews.Author: Anja_1204
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most excellent I have ever been in. Everything is just perfect: breakfast, room, interior, lightening, friendly staff, dining. We were in december s time, when not only all the city is marvelous but the even the hotel was magical. Defenitely take the see-view room high as possible, you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent at all levels”
Reviews.Author: ahmadsameh
Reviews.Content: Just got back from five days at this hotel. I was a bit worried having read some of the reviews here but I had one of my best experiences anywhere. I was given an upgrade to a club room on the 31st floor with pool view (who cares you're not going to spend much time in your room anyway). their club lounge was amazing with incredible service all the way through. Free wifi and the room was constantly cleaned and checked and double checked by housekeeping. Also had dinner at Grissini their Italian where the food was awesome even though some of the staff seemed stuck up especially since we were not their local clientele. As for location it is right next to the star ferry into Kowloon and you can walk into central very easily, also HK has one the world best, cheapest and cleanest public transport system. Overall this is a five star hotel through and through. The rooms are a bit dated as far as decoration is concerned but they were a good size for HK, very clean and very comfortable. I would definitely stay there again and highly recommend this hotel in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice when traveling to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: HeyMan76
Reviews.Content: Spent two days at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong on my way to a week long business trip to Saigon. Hotel is located directly on Victoria Harbor next to the convention center. It’s a good location if you’re attending a function at the convention center or catching the ferry to Kowloon (the Star ferry dock is less than a ten minute walk). But you’ll need to take a cab or the MTR (Hong Kong’s subway), if you want to go to the central district which is where most of the action is. Maybe I was expecting more since this is supposed to be the Grand Hyatt’s flagship property. That’s not to say that it wasn’t very nice, it was. But it wasn’t any different than any other Grand Hyatt property I’ve been to. I was in a standard king room but I was upgraded to a harbor view at no charge. Perhaps because I have Platinum status in Hyatt’s Gold Passport program or just because of the fact that I asked. The room was average size to perhaps a bit on the small size but this is Asia after all and space is at a premium. Rooms are furnished with a modern wood décor which gives them a “boutique” hotel look. The bathrooms are marble with gold fixtures which is a bit odd. It looks as though they may have remodeled the rooms but left the bathrooms in their original state. The hotel does have a very nice rooftop pool with a tropical feel. There’s a pool bar and restaurant that reminded me more of a resort setting than a city business hotel. There is a spa and exercise room that’s nicely equipped with all of the modern equipment you’d expect to find in a five star hotel. There are several restaurants located in the hotel but with so many dining options available in Hong Kong I never had the chance to eat in the hotel. While the cab ride from the airport will set you back approx. $60-$70 (US), cabs to just about anywhere in the city are extremely inexpensive. I almost felt bad being charged what amounted to $2-$3 for a 10-15 minutes cab ride. Any city in the states would cost five times or more. I opted for the hotel bus from the airport to the hotel which costs $19 (US) each way. On my trip into the city I was the only one on the bus. It takes around 45 minutes with no traffic. You can take the MTR Airport Express which gets you from the airport to central station in 22 minutes for $8 (US). The problem is you’ll have to transfer to another line (which is then another 10 minute walk to the hotel), or take a free shuttle bus that runs between central station and downtown hotels including the Hyatt. If you have anything bigger than a small suitcase this is not a very good option. There are lots of things to see and do in both Hong Kong and Kowloon but the cities are small enough that you can hit just about everything in a few days Shopping of course is a big draw but don’t expect to find any bargains. Prices in the name brand stores (Gucci, Burberry, and all the other big name designers), are more expensive than you’ll find at the same stores in the states even without the tax. Make sure you head over to Soho for dinner. There are some great restaurants that cater to just about every cuisine in the world. The incline train is a great way to get to the top of Victoria Peak. The views are amazing but make sure you get there early. I went up at around 9:30 AM and waited in line less than ten minutes. When I came back down the hill around noon the wait was over an hour long. In all my stay in Hong Kong while short was an interesting and enjoyable one and my stay at the Hyatt was very comfortable. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. If you have any specific questions I can answer for you please feel free to send me a email.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: jamo5468
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay on the Island as I normally stay in TST at the Sheraton but I thought it would be good for a change.The Hyatt is located in a fairly non descript area behind the Convention centre of Wan Chai and there is not much around the Hotel in the way of shopping but a couple of streets away is the seedy area with all the Bars/Nightclubs etc.Away from all that the Hyatt is an outstanding Hotel with the largest Pool in HK overlooking the Harbour which is like a tropical oasis with all the Palm trees etc.The service encountered was second to none during my stay as everywhere you turn a staff member is there and somehow most seem to know your name which blew me away seeing I was only there for 3 nights.The Rooms were excellent and all Food and beveridges were fantastic as well.The only downside probably is the posistion but the other positives far outweigh the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Just Gold Class!! Absolutely amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: ChillOutLou
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this wonderful hotel during my husband's conference in May this year. It was absolutely wonderful. I was really impressed by the cleanliness and how polite everyone was. Everytime I come across a staff member, whether in the lobby, the corridor or in the lifts, they would always have a smile on their faces whilst saying hello to me. It was very welcoming and comfortable. The room was extremely CLEAN and COMFORTABLE. The mattress was so soft and comfy! We slept better than back home! The cleaning lady paid particular details to cleaning the room and leaves daily complimentary water bottles for us. The bathroom was a large Victorian Gold plated room with both a bath tub and a shower. Everything was well maintained and clean. We loved the gym and the pool. The staff members were also polite and they made sure we have a constant refill of water bottles, towels and wiped our equipments after use. This hotel is conveniently located in Wan Chai and just under 10 mins walk to the MTR train station. There are lots of local cheap eateries, bakeries, supermarkets and fine dining restaurants around the neigbourhood. I would definitely return to stay when we visit HK again. It was just a Gold Class experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt is reliable and service was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: StAntonJulie
Reviews.Content: Having not been to Asia for 5 years I had forgotten how good service was here. Can't really fault anything but it's not an exciting hotel. Trip also marred by visit from hong kong government officials who "took over" the hotel. Meant rest of us were 2nd class citizens. Body guards and officials everywhere. Party caused traffic chaos so taxis started avoiding the area which meant waiting for some time most mornings. Hotel is not great for central and wan chai tube too far when it is hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a few kinks...!”
Reviews.Author: Lucifel
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a product of Hyatt and lives up to its name. However, its getting a bit old and you can see it on the inside. The room is very comfortable with great amenities, but lacks the technology for some of us techie guests. It reminds you of the good opulence of the late 90' s but it can use a facelift to get it up to date imo. Overall the stay was nice and I had no complaints. Staff was courteous and as business user I was satisfied with my stay. Next time though I might opt to stay at the Mandarin or Shangri-la for central convenience to the office and eats. The hotel was a bit far for me to commute. It is probably good for visitors with the view which is magnificent! I loved the.Chinese restaurant in the hotel. Few of the best I've tasted. Also the location is good for making rounds into hong kong. For me weekend was the only few time I had. Personal use would be here or the Shangri-la, business would be Mandarin for short commute.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay :)”
Reviews.Author: betma12
Reviews.Content: Room: Years ago, I have stayed in the Grand King Room once. I found it funny that they were using those super-old-heavy-cube-shape TV set while most of the 5 stars hotel in HK has already changed it to flat-screen tv. I wonder if they still have it or not... lol Anyway, this time, we have booked a Plateau Deluxe Room. (Super Pricey). The furnishing and design is AMAZING. It's modern while keeping a "Japanese + Zen" atmosphere. It also has a huge granite jacuzzi tub with glass window, over looking the Victoria Harbour and the flat tv screen. We are able to sleep well on the tatami-style bed. Staff and Service: The bell captain are helpful and friendly. A staff named Joanna who checked in for us on the G/F is inexpereinced on dealing guests. When I asked for late check out, she immediately rejected me without checking the room status. She was also looking at some codes on a paper and calling other staff for re-confirmation. Perhaps she is a Summer trainee? On the other hand, a staff named Kadey on 11/F is professional with great product knowledge, introducing the in-room amenties in details. Staff in Grand Club on 30/F and 31/F is super helpful and friendly too. The check in time was 14:00 but the room was not available until 15:20. They apologized by giving us a box of chocolate, an apologize card and late check out until 15:00. I was impressed by the card as it was very well-handwritten. In addition, I have to give special credits to Housekeeping and Room Service. I kept a bottle of champagne in the fridge and was planning to call Room Service after dinner for an ice bucket for chilling. When we returned the room from dinner, the bottle of champagne has already been chilled in the ice bucket and was nicely set on the table! F&B outlets: As we live in Hong kong, we have always been to the F&B outlets. I would recommend the tea or dessert buffet at Tiffins lounge for the ladies. Great dessert selection, cozy atmosphere with live Jazz music. The coffee shop is an ideal place for business lunch, high ceiling, friendly staff. The food at Kaetsu is great; but Matsubishi at Renaissance Harbour View Hotel (which is next to Grand Hyatt) is better. The food at Grissini is okay; the food overall are salty. Nicholini's at Conrad is much better. Thumb up to the buffet breakfast at Grand Club on 30/F Outdoor Swimming Pool and Spa: It's Hong Kong...one of the most densely populated areas in the world, so we couldn't expect a large swimming pool. It also gets crowded on Sunday. Massage is fine. Nice Spa room. Salon: I have been to the salon once. It belongs to the IL Colpo Group. I was shocked when they charged me (around 40 bucks!? couldnt remember the exact price) for a glass of Ice lemon tea as other salons from the same chain wouldn't charge customers. The hair stylists are professional; but the price, again, are more expensive than the other IL Colpo Salonsss. Would recommend the travelers to go to the one in Central or Causeway bay if they have time. Overall, we have a memorable experience. The Room is awesome and the staff is very well-trained. Grand Hyatt Hong Kong is really one of the best hotels over the decade.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a BAD experience”
Reviews.Author: LZSR
Reviews.Content: We had one of those bad to worse experiences at this hotel. I chose to stay here based on many good reviews & the family pool area was a big pull as we were traveling with our infant son. We were in transit on our way home to Sydney from London for 3 nights. I will try & keep this brief. We booked a "Grand Hyatt King" expecting something special. The first room we were given was on the 10th floor (this hotel has about 60 floors...) and when we arrived the room was not made up. We were then given another room on a much higher floor, with sincere apologies. But we wondered why we had to experience a dirty room in order to be given a room on a higher level? This hotel has about 1000 rooms. The room was small & pokey and the view was mainly of Kowloon and not much of the Harbour at all – so it was nice but not that special. Unfortunately what they wont tell you when you book this hotel - is that at the moment (july 2011) it is surrounded by major "reclaiming harbor" renovations. (see photos) This means that there is construction noise from 7am-7pm each day and getting in and out of the hotel is unpleasant due to stand still traffic, noise and pollution. It was a disaster. The noise traveled up to the hotel. We were jet lagged so trying to rest during the morning – it was impossible. Only after several complaints and 2 further room changes were we moved to a much higher room on the other side of the hotel - but we basically had to completely loose the plot at them in order for them to move us to the more expensive side of the hotel to escape this noise. (Which we thought we had booked but obviously not) The service was less than average, the room service was so bad and it was so expensive, and overall the hotel is one big rip off & they don't seem to care to look after western travelers. One of the rooms they tried to put us in smelt of cigarettes! We were traveling with an infant for goodness sakes! Unfortunately we struck very bad weather while we were here, it rained the whole time, so we did not get to utilize the lovely pool area once, but however, even if we wanted to the noise & dust from the construction would have made it unbearable. Oh how we regretted not booking the four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service over a decade”
Reviews.Author: anthonymhlee
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt in Hongkong is among my favourite hotels in the world over a decade. It is neither the newest nor the trendiest hotel in Hongkong, but I have been choosing it for each of my trip to Asia for its exceptional/thoughtful service from the concierge to the Grand Club. The Grand Hyatt in Hongkong is one of rare places where I feel at home....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: skibumno1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the way back from working in South Korea, and was really impressed. The room was a really good size and had a huge window with great views over the harbour. There was a large bathroom with bath and separate shower, and the hotel had provided a range of items such as bathrobes, loofas, cosmetics and toothbrushes. The staff were incredibly helpful and pleasant, and although I didn't have chance to eat breakfast there myself, I heard from other guests that it was of good quality. I thoroughly recommend this hotel, and only regret that I didn't stay for longer.

Reviews.Title: “always great service and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: PrincessMaz
Reviews.Content: great location and vey good concierge and taxi service to get you where you need to be. Harbour and Central view rooms are great but inward looking rooms at the back are not - you're looking onto a service apartment block. The buffers are great and service is always terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: Feigum
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for both business and pleasure. Breakfast was fantastic, pool area (largest hotel pool in HK) was great and rooms were very comfortable. Would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views of Kowloon...”
Reviews.Author: VfB 1893
Reviews.Content: We spent one night only at the GH HKG and should have stayed a little longer. The views (Kowloon) from the Club are simply great, not to forget the view we had towards HKG Island from our room. Really worthwile. In comparison to the other Hyatt at TST (Tsim Sha Tsui) this Hyatt is more opulent and heavier in it´s decor. Not bad, but a matter of taste. It is a great hotel and we enjoyed that short night and the steaks in the restaurant attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Getabreak
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this return visit to HK Hyatt after 10 years. Well run and friendly staff in great location and with really good view from Executive Club which is well worth paying the extra for. Quality snacks and non-stop Moet during cocktail hours. Fantastic breakfast overlooking the harbour. Rooms soon to be refurbished but pretty good anyway . Definitely worth using a Hyatt Club upgrade voucher if you have one. Would not bother experimenting with a different hotel during future visits.

Reviews.Title: “had a huge problem, but they went out of their way to try to make it up...”
Reviews.Author: PassportAlwaysOnHand
Reviews.Content: unfortunately my air conditioner broke. There were no other rooms available, and it was incredibly hot in the room. The manager went out of his way with me, giving me a complementary day and a lot of Hyatt Gold Passport Miles. Beyond that, a great hotel. Little bit of construction going on around it causing a bit of noise, but that is not their fault. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Honesty of room personnel blew me away”
Reviews.Author: steph1951
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt early and late June on our way to and from Europe. My watch was returned to me personally by a member of staff on our homeward leg. I had no idea I had left it there and had given it up as lost! I was blown away by this show of honesty and follow up. In addition EVERY one of the staff in the Grand Club made everything happen for us no matter how small. We will return based on concierge SERVICE and of course the HONESTY alone. The breakfasts are as good as any we have had in the world and the new Steak House was a sensation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Views and Service - Great club lounge.”
Reviews.Author: PFoggSydney
Reviews.Content: The suites are about to refurbished, so at the moment they are a bit dated but still they are as comfortable as ever. This is a large hotel which is excellently run. The service is seamless. The Club Lounge maybe the best the world. However, the crowning glory is always the mesmerizing harbour views. For a large hotel it is highly recommended although inevitably the swimming pool area is crowded. The spa was up to standard. Hotel car transfers are worth it if you have a lot of luggage. It was very difficult leave, a few days extra here would have been a very good thing.

Reviews.Title: “My best choice!!”
Reviews.Author: One111
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in hong kong. Nice view good location. Very best service from hotell staff. No.1 hotel in hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Loud constuction below hotel”
Reviews.Author: drmkweiss
Reviews.Content: Beware loud construction down on street level....constant banging....hotel is somewhat dated. Overall nice but perhaps not worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service in Grand Club”
Reviews.Author: york_701
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for business. Efficient service throughout the hotel, and fabulous service in the Grand Club which has panoramic views across the harbour. The Club has a well equipped business centre with computers and printers etc. There is free wi-fi in the Club rooms as well as in the Club. Evening drinks and canapes are of a high standard. We stayed in a suite which was very spacious but the furniture looked dated and tired. We have previously stayed in a hotel room here which had a cleaner, more modern appearance than the suites. Like some other reviewers we noticed a mouldy odour in the room but a request for an air purifier from housekeeping was promptly attended to and made a big difference. At times the smell of cigarette smell entered the room even though we were on a non-smoking floor. Again, the air purifier took care of this pretty effectively.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Business meeting”
Reviews.Author: akhanisanjay
Reviews.Content: This was a bussinees meeting at the hotel. We have 40+ attnedes for the neeting. It was nice experience in total. It was excellent arrangement from Airport pick up to check-in, in room servises, meeting room arrangement, free internet, food. Our client was very happy with hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Where_II
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business and was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel was well decorated and the room was very comfortable. I found the gym to be one of the best gyms I've seen at a hotel and the outdoor pool was nice. I ate the dinner buffet and the sushi was amazing. Overall a very relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo good!”
Reviews.Author: woozal27
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of nights and were thrilled with our stay. We had a harbor view and access to the Club Level for drinks and appetisers and breakfasts. The service was outstanding and I did not notice shabbiness expressed by other reviewers. Good location close to MTR and there are great local markets at Wan Chai where you see the real Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as before”
Reviews.Author: bodpa
Reviews.Content: It's the third time I go to this hotel, which was really good for business. But now, based on the high price it is not a good hotel. Not very clean, not very friendly. Hong Kong is changing, and Grand HYATT follows the same way. Stain on the sheet, A/C regulation didn't work ... Note that the Internet is not free Next time I will try to find a better one ; for the price it would not be difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Individualized Service”
Reviews.Author: wkopp
Reviews.Content: Being a Grand Hyatt, the facilities at the hotel are top notch. We had a great Harbor View Room. At check-in, one of the front desk staff took us up and showed us everything and took some time to listen to our travels. He provided us with great recommendations for while we were there as well. The room was quickly serviced each day. The room service was above average. The pool was a relaxing spot to hang out with fun drink choices. A very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely 5 star standard”
Reviews.Author: Englishviajera
Reviews.Content: A one night stopover only at this hotel but a good start to my trip. Lobby was very busy but check in was efficient, staff were friendly. I had a large room with a view of the next door convention centre roof ( more impressive than it sounds,) and a sideways view of the harbour. Best was the huge bathroom of many mirrors & fluffy towels. It's definitely 5 star standard, rooms are a little bit dated but very comfortable and have all the amenities you'd expect. A night time walk round the lovely pool area made me wish I'd come prepared for an early morning swim. Made do instead with the tempting breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Exceedingly Average”
Reviews.Author: liaobuqi
Reviews.Content: When I first stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong in 2009 I noticed little cards around the room noting that they were celebrating their 20th anniversary. I then looked around the room at the walls, desk and lay-out and quickly came to the realization that the rooms had not been remodeled at all over the past 20 years. Sure there was a new TV and new sheets etc, but for the most part the room is absolutely ancient. This is a problem that plagues many hotels in HK, so not unique to Grand Hyatt, but for $400-$500 a night, you would expect more. For instance there is only ONE plug in the whole room, clearly owning to its creation long before the advent of laptop computers. Lights are turned on and off with these weird plastic pull switches and the room just feels stale. On the positive side the bathrooms are excellent. Large, spacious and with amazing water-pressure. I am a big fan of Hyatt and usually chose to stay with them when travelling, but this hotel just isn't that great and doesn't deserve its hefty room rate. While it is nice to have a harbor view room, the location of the hotel is actually pretty far from anywhere nice. You need to take a taxi or long walk to get anywhere to have a nice bite to eat. It is also a massive, bustling lobby that has the pace and noise of a train station and detracts from the "luxury" feel they are going for. Staff are generally impersonal (which is to be expected in a hotel with that many rooms, but its just another detraction from the place. The bed is comfortable, the room service OK and the concierge is helpful (although you usually need to wait in a line to see them), the issue just is that the hotel doesn't really excel at anything and even though I still stay there from time to time, it's always a bit of a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Practical”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, excellent service, incredible food and really comfy bed. The location was nice too. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: LuneLune
Reviews.Content: I have spent months in this hotel for the last years and can only recommend it for the businessmen looking for a hotel located nearby central, especially its Club Floor level which is clearly well appropriate for business meetings in a cosy environment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jasonrekk
Reviews.Content: great location, fantastic view. I selected the hotel as I had read so much good about it here on Tripadvisor and Haute compass and I can only agree. The only shortcoming is that the pool area is very often in shadow.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: NYCnana
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Nicest Hyatt hotel I have ever visited. - Upgrade to a Harbour view if you can. Its worth it. Views in the morning and at night are so fantastic - Rooms are not big but they dont feel small either. The bathroom is really really nice. Bed is super comfortable with a huge window right next to it, the feeling you get from the view as soon as you wake up is great to experience. - We did not try the food at the restaurants, but the room service was delicious - Service at the hotel is top notch. Absolutely everyone at the hotel went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied - Go to the pool bar at night and have a drink, the atmosphere is really cool - The location of the hotel is really great. Also, taxis in Hong Kong are VERY cheap so just take a taxi to get to places that are not within walking distance. We used the subway once just so we could experience it but traveled by taxi every other time because it was easier. The most expensive ride we paid from the hotel was $20 US , this was for a taxi ride of almost 35 minutes. - It is also very easy to get from the airport to this hotel. Just take the airport express which will take you to a stop where you will transfer to a bus that will take you to the hotel. Its the last stop. - We also stayed at the W Hong Kong during this visit. This was also a really nice hotel but between the two I would say that the Grand Hyatt was better. The rooms at the W are trendier. However the views, location, service, and overall facilities of the Hyatt are very superior. - The general feel of the hotel is sophisticated and classic. Although a little expensive, I would highly recommend. You will enjoy and always remember your stay at the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice”
Reviews.Author: ReisenderCH
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is on HK Island, next to the Convention Centre. Location is good, but you have only a view on the harbour, not directly across to Kowloon. Rooms are modern, a bit worn out, maybe around 35 square meter. Fitness room is large, Spa is huge. Also very large outside pool.Plenty of restaurants in the Hotel, but all quite expensive. It is worth taking a little walk for cheaper places in the neibourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Still the cozy place after many years!”
Reviews.Author: yxc166
Reviews.Content: Good location to go anywhere in central, always have lines of taxi waiting outside, quiet floor and room!

Reviews.Title: “Another great and luxury stay”
Reviews.Author: milestone11
Reviews.Content: After couple of stays at this property, I could enjoy another magnifique days at Grand Hyatt Hong Kong. Most of all, staff is very polite, helpful and at your assistance at any time if needed which made my stay so comfortable and relaxing in typical Asian style. Food and Beverage is great, I would like to recommend the Grand Cafe for casual dining, including sumptous buffets either for breakfast, lunch or dinner, or, as an alternative also international selection and wide variety from the menu, moreover Tiffin lounge with great life music bands and delicious meals especially in the afternoon until late evening with great choices of desserts and fine drinks, and also Grissini Italian restaurant, one of the top restaurants awarded all over Hong Kong for typical Italian cuisine; try the Pasta dishes - you will never find it anywhere. No cheap hotel, but more than worth going there for some days either for business or leisure. It is a MUST if you spend some days in that Asian megacity!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull place”
Reviews.Author: KaterinaKozlova
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt is a great place to stay wether you came for business reasons or just for leisure. Rooms are beautifull: very comfortable and quiet. The bed is just fantastic - I don't know where did they find such great mattresses and pillows but you feel like you are flying in this bed :) I also loved the location. Breakfasts are hearty and very very tasty, but I remember it was somehow very cold in the restaurant in the morning. There's no need to say anything about cleanliness - it was ideal. Staff is very friendly, super-polite and always ready to help you. Maids are as noiseless and unnoticeable as shadows, I appreciate it. Beautifull place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with great open air pool on the 11th. floor”
Reviews.Author: Sbagehorn
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice business hotel that has rooms with fantastic views and an open air pool on the 11. floor. Sadly they doubled the room rates as of Jan 1st. 2011, so I will have to wait until they reduce that again... :-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Jordan_Silber
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong several times this year both for business and pleasure, and both in the main hotel and also in the smaller “hotel within a hotel” inside the Plateau Spa. By comparison, for business reasons I have also stayed at the Mandarin Oriental and Four Seasons this year, and I have to say that I greatly prefer the Grand Hyatt for four main reasons: the public spaces, the spa/pool/recreation, the dining options and, most important, the dedication and care of the staff which is both top caliber and truly genuine. I feel like they really want to help you and want your stay to be looked back on with fondness. They go the extra mile. I have had some fairly average service at Mandarin Oriental, and some slightly better service at Four Seasons, but the service at Grand Hyatt has eclipsed either of those other two properties. In terms of public spaces, the sounds of the jazz floating through the lobby and the care that is taken in maintaining the facilities provides for a relaxing, wonderful experience. I feel like walking into the Grand Hyatt is like walking into a scene in a movie. The public spaces are so opulent as to be almost breathtaking: huge winding marble stairs and columns; absolutely enormous arrangements of fresh flowers; intuitive design – its just simply a delight to walk into this place. This just gets better as you go upstairs to discover Plateau Spa and the enormous pool and sundeck. I’ve had 3 massages at Plateau this year, in all cases, highly professional and skilled masseuses putting me at complete relaxation and buffing out every knot in my back. True pleasure. In terms of dining, my absolutely favorite is Kaetsu; this is the freshest sashimi I’ve experienced outside of Tokyo and the place is beautiful in design. But I can say good things about each of the other restaurants, too, and it’s nice to have such a large selection inside the hotel, particularly when I’m on business and may have only a short time to eat and no time to go exploring. Speaking of being on business, let me mention that I have had very good business services here including, importantly, a fast and stable internet connection from the room. I can count on working here. This is my go-to place in Hong Kong for business or pleasure, and I can highly recommend the hotel. A+.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - clean room but a bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: RMJK
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Grand Hyatt over the last 2 years. The hotel has a good location next to the harbour but a short taxi ride away from all the shopping and attraction. The hotel common area is very grand and lavish and the sevice is very good. The rooms though look a bit outdated now, especially if you compare the other hotels around - Conrad, Marriott, Shagrila. The rooms i guess have not be upgraded in a while now and it shows a bit. Mind you, the rooms a very clean and spacious and the bathroom is lovely. Almost 70% of the rooms have a view of the harobour and that can be a plus. The pool is small and found it very close to the restaurant and the common sitting area. Overall, its a good grand hotel next to the harbour but in terms of luxury, there could better around but only marginally.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and food”
Reviews.Author: hagan_dazz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic harbor view, big room, great breakfast and room service. What's not to like? If the bill is on my tap, I think it is pretty expensive (hotels in HK are generally expensive) but Hyatt does delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View, good location”
Reviews.Author: so_traveller
Reviews.Content: Location: The location of the hotel is good, in the Wanchai area, next to the convention center. The walk to the MRT station is about 10 minutes (you can cut through the street from the front entrance or walk through the convention center and walkway using the 2nd floor exit by the meeting rooms). Wanchai itself is interesting and has enough good restaurants around, but the metro ride to Central and Causeway Bay is quick. I prefer to stay on Hong Kong island side as oppose to Kowloon, but I know that a lot of tourists prefer Kowloon so this wouldn't be the best location if you want to hang around on Tsim Sha Tsui. Service: Check in was excellent. I forgot the name of the receptionist checking us in but she was gracious and extremely welcoming. The staff in the Regency Club was across the board professional and pleasant. Food: We only had breakfast in the Regency Club. The food was good, not memorable. Chinese selection in the club was not very good, but the western choices were nice. Gym/Pool: The gym was very nice, new and complete equipment. Again, gym reception/staff were very professional and helpful. The outdoor pool looks very nice but we didn't use. There's a big sauna in the locker room. Room: If you have a room looking across the bay to Kowloon, it's breathtaking, especially at night with all the lights. The room itself is a good size, but not large. They have June Jacobs products if you like that. But the view really trumps all.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: paulconway
Reviews.Content: amazing hotel, everything about it was flawless...views from room were astonishing...you deffinitely need to get Harbour view room...we had to close the curtains so we could get ready to go out cause the views was out of this world! we met someone we knew in HK so were able to see the real HK which i feel is something you miss when in these types of hotels.. i would love to stay here again if i was back in HK but its so pricey! i was really lucky cause my uncle paid though...but if you can afford it this is the place to stay. dont but anything in the hotel you will regret it as you can walk 2 mins down the street and get whatever you want for a fraction of the price and see HK for what it really is!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant stay with superior service and attitude”
Reviews.Author: SFjoe
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped out of the car arriving from the airport and greeted by one of the managers I knew that the Grand Hyatt had not lost its touch from my last visit two years ago. Yes I am a Diamond member with their FF program but from watching other people being served I frankly think they got service as good as I did. Simply professional and attentive. My suite was not ready (8:30am) so the manager escorted me to the club room to enjoy breakfast and then returned 15 minutes later to say the room was ready. Now when was the last time you had a request for an early check in ready at 9am in the US and the room was actually ready? Or that the staff came to you personally to sit at your breakfast table to check you in so that I did not have to go stand in line at the front desk? Had this been a US property (Hyatt included) I would have been told the room is not ready and come back in two hours and "manage to entertain yourself in the meantime". The hotel market in Asia knows how to treat its valued customers from begining to end. The room view was fabulous and the club room served excellent quality food. A full breakfast and enough food in the evening that we did not even go out for dinner. Marbled bathrooms and wood paneling throughout. I could walk to the ferry to Kowloon and the hotel was close to major bus lines. No complaints not one and that is very unusual for my postings.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: diluce
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong for 3 days in Sept. The service was fantastic and prompt, and the room (Grand Deluxe Harbour View) was spacious, with one of the largest showers I've seen in a hotel. Had Grand Club access, which was great for breakfasts and expansive canape spreads in the evenings. Very quiet area with attentive service. Best part was the location. Next to the convention centre for business travellers, and less than a 5 minute walk to the ferry to TST. The MTR was approx. 10 minute walk, but could be gotten to all under cover through the convention centre and above-street walkways - convenient during the rainy season.

Reviews.Title: “My regular spot in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Galubushka
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why this is so low in the rankings -- it is almost certainly the best hotel in Hong Kong. Whilst I, obviously, cannot have stayed in every hotel, there, I have stayed at / visited many of the others higher on the list and in my opinion the positions are incorrect. Nonetheless, taste is subjective, as they say and the Grand Hyatt, Hong Kong is not perfect: for example, the rooms are a little dated, apart from the new Plateau Spa rooms. Check out The Club floors -- the view is stunning.

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: keva40
Reviews.Content: well we all went back to the grand hyatt this year again.... as ive said before flying is a big thing to me so i had a upgrade this year and it was alot better... if this helps anyone.... staff at the hyatt were all very help full as always. nothing was to much. one thing im a geat believer of .is talk to the staff! NOT talk down to them!! this goes along way in life... the food was lovely. for the to boys age 16 17 there was lots to do... so that was a big help.. PS THANK YOU MR FULLER.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: TadgeHongKong
Reviews.Content: We got a deal to stay at the GH. Check in easy, room nice, clean, great bed and views. breakfast and afternoon tiffin included. Had massage in Spa and got discount- just as well as would have been more expensive than mandarin which has better spa facilities. Pool use included, nice area. often packs of kids running around unsupervised but service good, be there early to get lounger as most go by 11. good deal all in all- this rate is not always available but worth asking about promotions. also pool would not be that good mid october onwards as too cold and shadowed.

Reviews.Title: “biggest pool in #Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: puzznic
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel in Hong Kong and specially liked the olympic sized swimming pool. With 50 meters lenght it is perfect for swimmers like me even it is not haped as square. Romm quality, service and location was superb as well. I can recommend this hotel further to everyone who can afford to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The lesser Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: daijobu
Reviews.Content: Compared to other Grand Hyatt hotels I have stayed in Asia, the HK Grand Hyatt is definitely the lesser. While the rooms are smaller even than the Tokyo Grand Hyatt (you would imagine it should be the other way around since the HK Grand Hyatt was built back in the 1980's). The bed is typically Hyatt, and comfortable. Bathroom has standing shower but looks dated thanks to the gold-trimmings. Tried the dinner buffet and was quite good, although my partner was ill a few hours due to food poisoning. Gym is good, but not extraordinary - Technogym equipment are now standard equipment for most Hyatts I've stayed recently - the Grand Hyatt HK's gym is larger than that of the Tokyo Grand Hyatt. The swimming pool, however, leaves much room for improvement. For one, the attendants have no sense of organization in ensuring guests can be given proper attention and assistance in getting sun-chairs. They simply let the early-birds hog the chairs without thinking that maybe later on there would be other guests showing up. When I showed up, the attendant basically just shrug his shoulders with a smile and walked off. All in all, this is a Hyatt-level property, but certainly not worth the $400+ daily rate the hotel currently charges on a typical night (breakfast not included). For less but better service, I prefer the Hyatt Regency TST instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: hoops7k
Reviews.Content: I stay here for two nights. Everyone is very friendly from check-in to check-out. The rooms are great but they may be getting a little dated. The only complaint I had was not being able to get the temp of the ac down. The lounge has a awesome view and they serve a real breakfast! The neighborhood is alittle bit slower pace then being in Tsim Sha Tsui Hyatt . I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and fantastic lounge.True 5 star..”
Reviews.Author: Gunal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and had lounge access. Lounge staff were very helpful and provided excellent service. My room was not harbour facing but lounge has great views. Excellent swimming pool and gym. Rooms were a bit small, but nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location is just slightly off”
Reviews.Author: mailtj
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Harbour Facing Grand Club Room. Nothing Extra- Ordinary about the room apart from the View which was fantastic. Room service was prompt and efficien. We ate in the Chinese and Italian Resturants along with the coffee shop ; the food was really good in all three places. The Conceirge was knowlwdgable and give us some good recomendations and advice.Over All I was very happy with the service all around. The Location is just slightly out of the way so you have to take a taxi everywhere ( ~ HKD20-30 for most downtown locations) and you cant just walk around and explore the nighbourhood. That said was very happy with my experience and would reccomend the place especially for business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: skhemka
Reviews.Content: The harbour view rooms are awesome. infact the location is ideal for a vacation. its right in the central of hk close to the shopping and LKF night life.

Reviews.Title: “A Real 5-Star”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Tallinn
Reviews.Content: A flawless hotel – everything works fine, from location to service and even free jars of pistachios and dry apricots in the room. A lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: mihir10
Reviews.Content: Excellent is the word for this hotel. From disciplined staff to the luxurious rooms, everything was just perfect. It is surely worth staying at least once if you visit Hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, Great View”
Reviews.Author: newyorkanya
Reviews.Content: The other reivews described this hotel perfectly: it is a large, generic Hong Kong business hotel which means it is clean, has a great view, is well situated and run very efficiently. No surprises here: wifi works, there is a large pool, shops, hair dresser, convention center next door. We stayed for two nights and were very happy although we noticed that much of the staff did not seem to understand our English. Our rate included the use of the lounge on the 30th floor. The breakfast was not great but it was fine and it was a large, comfortable, quiet room with lots of sofas and so a perfect place for meetings. There are some nice walks nearby--we cut through a lot of traffic and strolled along the water and saw the small boats--and various shops. It's also a 20 minute walk to Central and much of that can be done by cutting through various shopping malls. My only warning is that it is really hard to get a cab between 5-7pm. On our first night, we waited 30 minutes on the hotel guest line in front of the hotel. The line at the convention center was even longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great service which can't be faulted!”
Reviews.Author: JaneMFraser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt, HK for the Rugby 7's tournament. In total we stayed 5 nights in a club room. Although I agree with the other critics that the rooms are a bit dated I could not fault the quality of the room. The beds are really comfortable. The room was immaculate and we even observed a room check by the head housekeeper - something I have never seen before. The staff in the club lounge were wonderful too especially Scott who made it his job to ensure that you were comfortable and taken care of. The breakfast served each morning had everything that you would want and to a very high standard. The evening cocktails and nibbles were also very good. I've stayed in club rooms before and this by far "shines". We ate at the italian one lunchtime and again it was faultless. Yes it was expensive but then again the whole of HK is expensive against the £ at the moment. My husband unfortunately came off the plane with a cold and needed some cold remedy unfortunately the shop was closed but the concierge opened the shop for him - now that's service. We had treatments at the spa too and again - pure luxury! I would definitely recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. We had a wonderful trip and would return to this hotel if we were visiting HK.

Reviews.Title: “expensive restaurant”
Reviews.Author: hohoho1
Reviews.Content: Like all HK luxury hotels, the grand Hyatt was very good but not outstanding. We stayed there for 8 nites and did know the hotel. We have 2 rooms facing the harbour. The sheer curtain was dated and could use replacement. It did not have flat panel TV which was most surprising considering a hotel of this calibre and price. The rest of the room was up to standard. They did accomodate my daughter early check in at 9am and the crib for her 20 months old toddler was ready in the room, (we did email them in advance). The panoramic harbour view is great and we have a premium seat to watch the Chinese New year firework display in the middle of the harbour. The location is not as convenient as the Island Shangrila/Conrad/JW Marriott combo which are near the Admiralty MTR and also have a much nicer walk to the Central business district. If you have business in convention center, Hyatt is great. The restaurant and food is expensive. Room service for a small children pizza, one fried rice and one won-ton noodle with tip and service charge was US $90. The buffett dinner in the open mezzanine floor was $100 per person including service charge. Scotch was $22 and we are not talking about 18 years old McCallen. If you are having a multiple courses dinner with alcohol in their premium restaurants, you better have a no limit charge card. The breakfast buffett is good but they did not have the variety I found in Island Shangrila when I stayed there two years ago. The 11th floor spa/gym/pool/children play area and outdorr grill restaurant is very good and superior to the Shangrila combo hotels. I arrived on Chinese New Year day and by next day, the hotel was full capacity and filled with Mainland Chinese coming to celebrate New Year. The service suffered. But this was an eye opener for me. It speaked volumes of the spending power of the affluent mainland Chinese people. They spare no expenses in food and drinks. They drank XO cognac and 18 years single malt scotch. Gand Hyatt did not give these away on discount. Women came back to the hotel with multiple shopping bags from the likes of Chanel and Prada. They have replace the Japaneses tourists of the eighties. The hotel did return to her normal quality service after the first four days when the crowds thin out and most of the people who stayed there are businessmen. PS : the Intercontinental Hotel (old Regent) is kind of tired and dated and except for the view from the ground floor restaurant, I was slightly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Typical HK Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeeingIsBelieving007
Reviews.Content: Personally I don't see a large difference between the main hotels on HK Island (Hyatt, Marriott, Shangri-La, Conrad) - all are good hotels and provide excellent service. THe Hyatt is located near the Convention centre, an obvious advantage if staying there. Although it may seem to be quite isolated it's actually a very hort walk to the bars and nightlife of Wan Chai, and a convenient walk to the Wan Chai MTR. Rooms are fantastic, the views from the harbour facing rooms are to die for. SOme of the most spacious rooms I have seen in Hong Kong. The food options are outstanding - breakfast and dinner buffets outstanding. Service god, sometimes a little overbearing. Recommended if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “A Little tired, awesome location,”
Reviews.Author: Lambani81
Reviews.Content: The Check in was fast. Room Service was impeccable. Location is close to the attractions on HK Island, Wan Chai MTR is 10 min walk, there's a DeliFrance opp the hotel, great breakfasts and the ferry to TST is a 5 min walk. The only crib I have is that the bathroom, though huge and clean, was a little dated and garish gold colored taps were a turn off....

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: keva40
Reviews.Content: ive got to say that our stay at the hyatt was the best! we have just got back from the hyatt berlin! and its nothing like the hyatt haongkong, so from me to you the hyatt hongkong is the way to go!! the hyatt hongkong have it to a T!!. can i just say i can not stand flying one bit!! BUT we are back off to hongkong this aug, again! and im staying at the hyatt....THAY ARE ALL SO LOVELY THERE.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience...”
Reviews.Author: vacationtime2000
Reviews.Content: It's what you would expect for a Hyatt. It's in a great location. Breakfast buffet is overpriced. But the views are AMAZING! But, be prepared for the smog. One morning while I was looking down at the view I saw a group of older people doing Tai Chi at 6am... in the middle of HK. It was a nice reminder of old world and new world. The only bad part was the I got horrible food poisoning after eating at the Chinese seafood restaurant at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Second to none”
Reviews.Author: RandstadJefe
Reviews.Content: All you can ask for. Great rooms, spectacular view, great food and the best lobby bar. And that is to put it mildly... The hotel is next door to the convention centre which is a big plus and not far from the FCI Mall...

Reviews.Title: “Massive disappointment directly after staying at Grant Hyatt Tokyo.”
Reviews.Author: ostramundo
Reviews.Content: Terrible. Had just stayed at the Grand Hyatt Tokyo, which was ultimate minimalist modern chic calm in the storm that is Tokyo. The Grand Hyatt HK's aesthetic is super traditional (heavy, dark, lots of carpet, etc etc), the rooms are cramped (no excuse for this, as the Grand Hyatt Tokyo's aesthetic is open and airy despite Tokyo also being a very densely populated city) with terrible heavy, wooden aesthetic, the bathrooms also dark and heavy (The Grand Hyatt Tokyo's bathrooms look out onto the entire room and the city), etc etc. Laundry service was awful (my clothing returned still dirty and reeking of Chinese food and cigarette smoke, neither of which was the case when they were submitted), the bar dark and a bit seedy, etc etc. Staff and speaking English not so great (surprisingly, Tokyo was better here, too). You get the point. I do not plan to stay here again if given a choice. The one positive was nice views (big windows) -- onto the smoggy HK harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in HK Island if a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: choth21
Reviews.Content: I just finished a stay here. If you need to be on HK Island, this is a great place to be. It is a bit of shlep from the nearest MRT, but cabs are so cheap in HKG that I didn't really mind that. I do think the rooms are a little 90s, and could use some updating.
