The lack of an ipod charger was a minor annoyance to me. Also, I didn't really like the system to turn off all the lights as it took me a little while to figure out. Overall, the rooms are very comfortable, but just seem a little dated. As a Diamond, my amenity was a bowl of fruit and a full bottle of a nice French wine. I also had free Diamond Access. Both the breakfast and evening spreads were pretty impressive, particularly the evening where there were two hot dishes, three cold canapes, and the usual cold cuts, dips, breads, antipasti, etc. I ate at One Harbour East, and it was pretty good, not stellar though. I checked out the gym as well. I think it's a bit bizarre, because a hallway runs right in the middle and it could use some better lighting, but overall, it was well equipped. Service was great and very courteous. and yes, the views are great, but I'm not really a view person and the novelty wears off after a few minutes I would really only choose to stay here if I need to be on HK Island and if I needed the stay credit. I prefer the more modern vibe of The Upper House or the Landmark MO. And if I need to be on Kowloon, I'd rather be at the Hyatt Regency TST, which I think is an excellent property.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best all round properties I have ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: Orang_County_greg
Reviews.Content: First class all the way. Incredible service and beautiful accommodations. I was two levels below the Club(or whatever they call it) and my view was insane. When possible I will stay here again, probably when I bring my wife as I tend to stay in 4* properties when I am solo.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for conventions!”
Reviews.Author: travelingtuboo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong for a conference at the adjacent HKCEC, which was directly connected to the convention center via the 2nd level and out a back door of the hotel. (I might add that the Renaissance Harbourview which is also adjacent to the HKCEC is slightly more convenient to the convention center, but less attractive than the Hyatt.) As I was traveling for business, I had to share the room with a colleague. We were a little disappointed by the lack of space in between the super single beds, e.g., they are so close together that if she or I were snorers or tossers in our sleep, we would have had a very terrible time sleeping in the same room. However, the room was clean and well furnished, with the most attractive feature being the bathroom. A full bathtub and separate large shower, with ample sink space and lighting. You get the regular amenities that you find in 5-star hotels, especially in Asia, bathrobes, slippers, good set of toiletries, soaps, etc. One other complaint, I had a lot of trouble finding the electrical outlets, aside from the one for the hair dryer at the vanity table by the door, and one for a shaver in the bathroom, it was only until I opened the closet which houses the safe did I find two outlets. The lobby of the hotel is done in Grand Hyatt fashion, it's got high ceilings, open staircases, huge vases with fresh flowers and gives off a regal impression. I didn't have a chance to have more than a quick bite in the 1st floor restaurant/coffee shop, so can't comment on the food and service. We had some trouble checking-in as our rooms were not ready, but the front desk staff person had us wait on the 2nd floor lobby lounge and offered complimentary drinks, which helped. All in all, the Grand Hyatt is a lovely hotel, and conveniently located in Hong Kong with helpful bell-boys and taxi-stand staff to get you on your way.

Reviews.Title: “The best I've ever stayed at , cant fined a thing that was wrong :)”
Reviews.Author: bell44
Reviews.Content: Perfect!! Just perfect. Everything was 100% so polite so clean so helpful, really can’t pick a fault. Room service whenever you want if you want your clothes cleaned, if you want and iron at midnight, there is nothing they wouldn't do for you. Their food was out of this world and well Hong Kong itself and Kowloon for that matter if you’re having second thoughts then DONT!! You will never forget the place and for all the right reasons!! Make sure you take a boat trip to the other side of the island; it’s a boat ride of sky scrapers!! Etherised that’s all you will see!! Do it at sunset its out of this world, the sky is beautiful still light with red bits the lights are coming on in the buildings, Then get off in Aberdeen and go to the Jumbo restaurant u will LOVE IT :) I usually make it my mission to never go somewhere twice, life’s tooooo short so much to see out there but this is one place I can’t wait to go back too!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but services too expensive!”
Reviews.Author: sunny92037
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hotel in HK for 10 days and truly enjoyed our vacation. The rooms are small but cozy and service was great. There were only a few drawbacks: 1) The prices for laundry are ridiculously high, 2} Cafeteria is too small for breakfast, waiting time up to 15 min. was required, food was extremely expensive. The location of the hotel was fairly convenient, the Wanchai MTR station was about 10 min. away on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Had to pay a substantial supplement”
Reviews.Author: GBMember
Reviews.Content: When we visit Hong Kong, we normally stay at the Intercontinental. However, this time we were attending a convention at the Convention Centre, so needed to be in Wanchai. So our travel agent booked us a double room on a Club floor The Grand Hyatt has some very good points * The location is perfect for the Convention Centre with a walkway taking you almost to its front door and is also close to the Wanchai ferry terminal * The club lounge is one of the best I have ever used and the service was very attentive * The harbour views are great * The bathroom was nice * The bed was comfortable * There was always a computer available. However, there were also downsides * If there was any disabled access to the club lounge, we didn't see it - you have to use a flight of stairs * The bedroom wasn't tiny but not huge either and the layout was terrible making it feel cramped * Some of the wardrobe doors were designed not to open - very awkward reaching round trying to get things out * The toiletries were nothing like as good as those at the Intercontinental * No free wifi in the rooms. But the worst thing was that we had booked a double room. When we arrived, we were told that this only entitled one person to occupy it and for both of us to be there, we had to pay a hefty supplement. We were not impressed. We will be staying at the Intercontinental again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for conventions”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter900
Reviews.Content: Excellent business hotel, attached to the Hong Kong exhibition center. Superb staff. Grand Hyatt quality. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic people”
Reviews.Author: MickFy
Reviews.Content: I have to say the people that work and the Grand Hyatt treat all guests with great respect and have a professionalism and politeness that I have not seen for almost 20 years of travel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: arreddy
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel was one of the best part of my Hong Kong trip and I can never forget this in my life.Be it honeymoon or just a family vacation, if you can afford the stay, you will never regret. Being a diamond member, I got a room in the grand club floor. What a marvellous hotel!!? I have no compliants. The good: 1) This hotel is just 5 mins drive from the interchange place ( the train station to airport ). 2) If you are interested in night life, this hotel is just a block away from all the action. 3) The hotel looks very royal and grand inside.The view from the 30+ floor grand club lobby onto the victoria harbour was amazing beyond imagination.It has been 1 year since I had been there and I still get excited when I think of that. 4) The service is excellent. Over all I will give 100 marks to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Fantastoc Grand Hyatt Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: AntneyD
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, well located and very clean and spacious. Rooms are of a good standard and the staff couldn't be more helpful. Food and drinks are expensive so would recommend eating and drinking outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: edgarn
Reviews.Content: We are regular guests there and as always get a great service, This time we were (un)fortunate to be upgraded to on of their old suite products and although the rooms are spacious (for hong kong) and very well equipped (DVD, Bose speakers etc) overall we did not like this room as much as their normal Grand Club (Executive Floor) room which are modern and comfortable. The Grand Club lounge is still one of the best places to sip a glass of Champagne while the sun sets down on Hong Kong harbour and the lounge staff are fantastic. The hotel gets very busy during conventions etc but otherwise always makes for a great stay in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Very smart but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: imhonot
Reviews.Content: Great hotel . Food ,dinner by the pool overlooking the harbour on the 15th or so floor was awesome and breakfast had it all.Rooms of course well equipped but you pay a lot in Hong Kong for any half decent well located hotel and this is a very decent very well located hotel !! So it is very expensive.The wine bar was £25 for 2 glasses , dinner easily £100 for 2 and the 24 hour stay for about £500 was memorable if dear.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: jglin
Reviews.Content: My hubby & I checked in and had a very pleasant surprise. We had a full large bottle of champainge and abox of chocolates and strawberries waiting for us in the room. Reason: my hubby had casually mentioned that we were celebrating our 2nd honeymoon! This shows that the staff was attentive. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and location was good. We are near to the ferry terminal and shopping mall/MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm...A bit underwhelmed"”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: I had better expectations of the Grand Hyatt in Hong Kong. When i got there i thought the location in Waichai was good but I thought the bars and restaurant were fairly average. The room i had which faced over the pool area was really average. the bathroom was good having said that, the room was just so-so..Pretty disappointing given the price i would say. There is a lot of competition in Hong Kong and this is just quite middle of the road, and having stayed in other Grand Hyatt's in China i had greater expectations. So actually on balance it was so average and was not great value so i would have to say i would look elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: bella_oes1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt HK several times and have found it to be very well located (short cab to IFC/city centre/causeway bay) clean, modern and has a very good level of customer service. If you can do so, I highly recommend booking the club floor, which serves moet (in fact you need to ask the waiters to stop trying to pour you drinks as they are almost too attentive) and a great array of hot and cold food. Also in the morning, there is a huge array of food and again, very personable waiters. I have stayed at the Four Seasons previously at IFC which is very modern and in a prime location, but I prefer to stay at the Grand Hyatt for the reasons outlined above and it tenders to be cheaper most of the time (or similarly priced).

Reviews.Title: “Magic, absolute luxury”
Reviews.Author: freshstartgetaways
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite here for a conference in September.. What a place, luxury, opulance, beautiful. The bed was fantastic. The bathroom beautiful marble. Everything about this place is style and elegance. I wish I could live there. The pool is magic. The hotel is right behind the Convention Centre which is a very space age looking building right on the harbour. Hong kong is such an amazing place and my aim is to try to return here for sure. It is a land of contrasts. Make sure you travel to Stanley on the double decker bus. Sit up the top at the front for the ride of your life, steep winding road. The markets at Stanley are alive but not the cheapest place to shop. We found the night market and ladies market at TST the best place to shop and we had so much fun bartering with the locals. What lovely people. After our stay here we moved across the harbour to the mainland and stayed at another 5 star hotel for 4 nights. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Grand Hyatt to anyone who enjoys the finer things in life.

Reviews.Title: “Conference hotel with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: AgentSmithDC
Reviews.Content: Even though the Grand Hyatt is adjacent to a major conference center, I never felt lost in a crowd. Service was prompt, professional and pleasant. The room was modest in size but very well designed - reminded me of a top-end hotel room in Manhattan, where space is at a premium just as it is in Hong Kong. Two criticisms (I had no criticisms of Shanghai or Beijing Grand Hyatts): Cell coverage was terrible. Even when I connected, calls were repeatedly dropped. Even the hotel's wireless service dropped me 3 times in an hour, and it is expensive. Second, service in the Grand Cafe, the core restaurant in the facility, was slow. The cell connection seems to be a city-wide problem. The internal wireless problem needs to get fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pickytraveler2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on business trip to Hong Kong. Outstanding hotel...excellent service, great location. Sure, it is a little pricey....but all nice hotels in the Central Business District are pricey. Excellent service from everyone...from the front desk to the wait staff to doormen, concierge. Harbor room had a great view. Room was very quiet, even though the Convention Center is being expanded and renovated near the hotel...was never a bother. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience at a Value for Money Cost”
Reviews.Author: grestymosman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong whilst attending two conferences at the adjoining HK Convention Centre. With my travel agent having not organised transport from the Airport to the Hotel for arrival at 4.30 AM on a public holiday and having a meeting at 9.30 AM, I was not amused. Thankfully the Grand Hyatt desk had a telephone. Whilst speaking to the concierge, a respresentative arrived who organised transport within minutes, so I was in the hotel by about 6 AM and at my conference at 9.30 AM. The attentiveness of staff was excellent, though the cost fo things like coffee, tea, drinks etc was a bit of a taling point amonst those attending the conferences. The bed and pillows were about the most comfprtable a have ever had and, unlike many other hotels in which I have stayed, the airconditioning was unobtrusive and the window system satisfactorily blokec external noise. I was able to rest and sleep comfortably at night abd awoke each day ready for the day's business. It is not a cheap hotel nor close to any real shopping but for busness visitors it is one of the best value for money I have experienced in 30 years of business and private travel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful business property”
Reviews.Author: Ketan-Adesara
Reviews.Content: Amazing views from the rooms that face the harbour. Superb pool and great spa. Food is ok though.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury”
Reviews.Author: LovetoshopLondon
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel ! The Hyatt is fairly new so in comparison to some of the more traditional hotels in Hong Kong it feels very modern and slick. The staff are incredibly helpful, as always for Hong Kong. The restaurants and bars are fabulous - we got a free drink pass for JJ's cocktail lounge when we checked in which has live music and plenty of choice for cocktails, perfect for unwinding after a long day. Grissini - the Italian restaurant - has amazing views of both sides of Hong Kong harbour through floor to ceiling panoramic windows. And the food was incredible too. The swimming pool is outside on a roof, its normally quite warm in Hong Kong so this wasn't a problem when we were there, but I would imagine if we were there when it was raining I wouldn't be too happy at not having an indoor choice as well. However the gym more than makes up for it and again, as the hotel is relatively new, everything feels very clean and smart. The rooms are very well appointed - more modern than some HK hotels which is rather refreshing and the mini bar is one of my favourites - snickers and mars bars - the perfect cure for jet lag! It is expensive and there probably are cheaper options you could go for but I think this one is worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “A Great View, A cut above ... at the RIGHT price.”
Reviews.Author: 7DegreesOfWonderment
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong has a great many of comfortable to luxurious hotels at which to stay. Honestly, I first chose this hotel in 2008 due to my loyalty to The Hyatt points card system, I was using a free accrued night and so stayed for the rest of the nights of my trip. I have been back three times since (and not just for the loyalty points lol). I won’t bore you with describing the services of a five star business hotel – let it suffice to say that this hotel boasts them all. The rooms have recently been given a splash of blond wood modernity – at odds with the bathroom style of black marble and gilded taps somewhat, yet, this is not a problem. I’d advise pushing for a corner room or a club floor room as, my first room at the hotel.. though it had an excellent view of Kowloon – was a tad small for its furnishings. The breakfast is great if pricey and the health and fitness amenities great. My first stay they had really awful generic toiletries that have improved a lot since. They are building a conference facility just below the Kowloon side view so ask for a high floor. The sunsets over HK harbour are one of those .. ‘so this is what it means’ moments …. A good place to stay in HK …. Make sure the price is right though.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: scorkey
Reviews.Content: Wonderful 5-Star Hotel. First class treatment and professionalism all the way! I stayed at the Grand Hyatt with my daughter over Chinese New Year using nights from the Faster Free nights promotion. Despite not being a "paying" customer, we were treated with elegance and respect throughout our stay. Prior to our stay, I had e-mailed the Grand Hyatt Concierge and asked for assistance with purchasing tickets for the Lunar New Year soccer tournament. The Concierge was pleasantly efficient and the tickets were waiting for us when we checked in. Upon check-in we were also offered to upgrade to the Regency Club level for HKD$600/night, but declined. Wendy and Esther at the Concierge Desk had great recommendations for sightseeing and transportation. They even remembered us when we returned in the evening or the following morning and asked us how our day went. Their attentive service really made our trip. Our room on the 27th floor was comfortable and nicely decorated. The bathroom was roomy and elegant with a marble shower and a large soaking tub. The only thing it lacked was a view of Victoria Harbour. Dinner and breakfasts at The Grill were good, though a bit pricey. The staff was attentive and the variety of food and beverages were ample. My daughter thought the place was "fancy". Hotel is not in the best of locations for sightseeing (in the urban area adjactent to the convention center), but it is a short walk to the STAR ferry or a short cab ride to the Central or Hong Kong MTR stations. Definitely will return!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gordonfuller
Reviews.Content: I travel to Hong Kong every other two months and found the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong is my favorite hotel,. Despite the fact that the location is not close to shopping centre, however HK is just so small and within 5 min by taxi you will get there. I don't want to stay in Central, work in Central and spend all my trip in Central. Sometimes it is good to stay away from the business crowd. Again I would rather spend sometime at the fitnes studio / spa to de-stree rather than shop, shop and shop... Leisure facilities are excellent, my room with harbour view and in good size. I like the decor simple again very functional and create the home feel, unlike last time I stay in a hotel near IFC Mall the rooms and lobby looks like an office. Must compliment the high speed wire & wireless connectivity everywhere. The only commented is the dated TV, hope they will change it soon. The staff are extremely professional especially in their Grand Club. I like they keep it very exclusive, either you stay at theClub floor or Suite you are allow to go. Unlike other hotel chain loyalty program it makes the Club Lounge like a train station serving big buffet.

Reviews.Title: “More hit than miss, but not the best choice for vacationers”
Reviews.Author: Denveresque
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 night stay at the HK Grand Hyatt. It is a grand hotel indeed, and we enjoyed our stay, but it fell short in some important respects and we did not think it lived up to some of the other Grand Hyatts in Asia. In summary, here are the pros and cons we observed: Pros: 1. Excellent staff. Excellent service. Impeccable all around. Always friendly, always helpful, always attentive, prompt and punctual. The people really make this hotel. 2. Some have commented that the lobby is garish or over the top. I thought it was lovely. Then again I love all things Art Deco, and the lobby is an Art Deco heaven. 3. Hard to imagine better views. Given the Grand Hyatt's position on the Hong Kong side of the Harbour, and its off center orientation, most harbor view rooms will showcase a panorama that includes Kowloon to one side, the Harbour in the middle, and Hong Kong skyline on the other side. It was simply breathtaking. We were on the 15th floor. While I usually prefer to be as high up as I can be, being lower at the Grand Hyatt actually gave you a better, more up close view. As we entered the room, it looked like we were floating right on top of the water. 4. Excellent on-site amenities and services, including great business center (prepare to pay through the nose), very nice fitness center, one of the better pools around (if you're interested in using one), many restaurant and lounge choices. 5. Pleasingly crisp and yet warm room decor. Comfortable and functional, and let the stunning view speak for itself without competing with it. These are not the biggest rooms in Hong Kong, but you won't feel cramped. Plenty of closet space and a very large bathroom with great shower water pressure. 6. The Star Ferry dock to Kowloon is very close by. Cons: 1. Except for those attending an event at the convention center, the location of the GH is pretty bad all around. We were there for pleasure and always thoroughly discover cities on foot. We didn't care about public transport stations, but it's still nice to have plenty of restaurants/cafes/shops in the vicinity. You will find very few around the GH. The neighborhood is dominated by office/government buildings, and many run down, seedy bars/clubs a few blocks away. There are many neighborhoods with great restaurants and shops, and others with a more authentic local eatery feel. We got neither of those around the GH. Expect to do a lot of walking through uninteresting neighborhoods around the GH before you arrive anywhere you'd actually want to spend some time. 2. The Champagne Bar in the lobby is a prostitute hang out. Perhaps this is something that's present in all large hotels, but it made me uncomfortable to be surrounded by prostitutes on the prowl at my hotel. They are quite blatant, so the hotel must knowingly tolerate it. 3. This may sound superficial, but the toiletries in the room bathrooms were the worst I've ever used in my life. Given the purported luxury of this hotel and the prices they charge for a night, you'd expect better toiletries. Bring your own, unless you want to use no-name toiletries that are runny and watery, and sting like astringent. Overall, a nice hotel, but for a pleasure trip you are better off staying at the Conrad, Mandarin Oriental, Island Shangri-La, or Four Seasons, all of which are way better situated to let you take full advantage of everything Hong Kong has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Kriselda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. Our double Harbour View room was quite large with a very comfortable bed and a big bathroom. The view looked out to Kowloon and was right above the construction site of the Exhibition Centre - not the most beautiful view and we could hear a little noise (even on the 16th floor) but certainly interesting! The room was well serviced and well maintained. I used the gym, which was popular and large (I think there are 2 of them) and had plenty of new equipment. Breakfast buffet was high standard, as was the buffet lunch - a great view, delicious food and quite an experience eating with the wealthy Hong Kong ladies! Dinner at Grissini (Italian) was so nice we went twice. Fresh grissini baked in the restaurant (you cannot stop at one!), white truffles over marscapone risotto and an extensive wine list. Add a wonderful view of the city and good service and it is a great place for a special night. The only downside is the location. Perfect if you are using the Exhibition Centre, but it's a bit of a hike to get to the nearest MTR station. This hotel really lived up to the "Grand Hyatt" name in the service. Every staff member we encountered was polite, friendly and pleased to help.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiSoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best hotel I have ever stayed at! The room we had had a full view of the Harbor, my own butler, and fresh fruit basket everyday! The hotel is connected to a main shopping mall and is in the center of all the action! The room was spotless and clean, the roomservice was amazing not to mention the incredible food! Wow is all I can say! I want to go back there soon! I traveled with my mother and we had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: brodyboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of a very long vacation in October and was truly a great way to kick off our trip. Everything was perfect. Service- we got in rather late on the first night and needed to find something to eat. I was really looking for something local and unique so I asked the concierge what he recommended. He sent us to this little local place short cab ride from the hotel with, arguably, the best Sichuan food I have ever had outside of San Francisco. Overall, the staff was the right mix of friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. Room - minimalist but very comfortable. The bed was just right -not too hard and not too soft. The bathroom was a good size with a great shower. Decor - a bit over the top [but what in HK isn't] but still tasteful and not tacky. Other - the gym was actually a good size and well equipped. The pool was large and the whole outside pool area was very nice. The hotel is located only a 5 minute walk from the Kowloon ferry and always has taxis waiting outside for a short hop to Central.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel with grand views”
Reviews.Author: Deshi2
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt really is very grand. Its size and views onto the harbour are extremely impressive. It is also just minutes walk away from the large conference centre which was hosting the event that we were visiting HK to attend. Given the horrendous traffic situation in HK, we were very glad we chose this location as it made getting to the conference centre stress-free. It is an expensive hotel, but the service was extremely good, and breakfast, which was included in our package was superb in both variety and quality. There is a mezzanine floor buffet restaurant which I highly recommend for afternoon tea and their fabulous dessert buffet (where you can actually get a full meal, but the onus is on dessert). We also ate at JJ's, a steak and seafood restaurant, the seafood being Thai influenced. It was so good we ate there twice. The spa is really modern and well equipped, but the therapies are expensive, and the therapists were not as good as one would expect for the price. The weather was terrible during our stay (a typhoon had hit the day before) so we did not use the pool or sit outside on the terrace, but it looked nice. We would definitely stay there again if we visted HK in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business”
Reviews.Author: pjslondon
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from another week spent in the Grand Hyatt in Hong Kong and am spurred to write to recommend it to others. Sure it's not cheap, but no 5* hotels in HK are, but the rooms are a good size, modern, airy and quiet and the facilities in the hotel are equally good. The Grand Cafe is great for breakfast and the room service menu has some nice options, although to be critical perhaps is not all that extensive but there are plenty of other eating choices even without leaving the building. For those more adventoruous it's only a short walk through the convention centre forecourt and via elevated walkways into the bussle of Wan Chai. The gym is very pleasant and the pool is great, never busy and possible to do 50m lengths by swimming up the middle! Staff are all charming and efficient and it's actually nice coming back at the end of the day, which can't be said of all business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Well Maintained and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: allanmc
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel as part of a Cathay 4-day package, so combined with airfares the room rate was acceptable, there is no way I would ever considering paying their advertised rack rate. All the staff we dealt with were very professional and friendly, i did not see an unhappy face during my stay..it was all smiles. While the rooms maybe a bit dated, they are very clean and comfortable. Great pool and surrounding gardens, an overall good hotel experience, helped by the very professional Hyatt team. If I had been paying the rooms rates advertised by the hotel directly, this review may differ as my expectations would have been higher but if you can combine it into a travel package then it is a very good choice and it will not dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fotocraft
Reviews.Content: Stayed once again at the Grand Hyatt in Hong Kong where the welcome and check in efficiency is second to none. I usually book an executive room with harbour views and have access to the executive club for complimentary breakfast and snacks/drinks throughout the day. The club room staff are excellent and are happy to give advice and suggestions on where to visit and shop. The one downside is the food quality. Meals are often served luke warm. This is one of my pet hates. I like my food served hot and my wine served cold not vice versa. The location is excellent within walking distance of the Star Ferry at Wanchai and situated next to the Convention Centre. The hotel is always busy but the foyer lounge is a haven and can be recommended for its buffet lunch amd the afternoon tea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: George_CY_BI
Reviews.Content: During one of my recent visits to Hong Kong, I was persuaded by one of my friends to try the Grand Hyatt instead of Four Seasons where I stayed a couple of times before. I must say that the hotel looks aging but not as bad as some people think they are. Having said that, I must say that their Philips TV is a joke!!!! Even a 3 star hotel will now have a LCD TV instead of CRT TV. What really disappoints me is the service there. Upon my arrival from a taxi, one of the bell boy came and assisted me. At the same time, there were another 3-4 bellboys and female staff standing around chatting. Neither “Welcome” nor “Good Morning”. The check-in process was some-what okay and I was escorted to the room by a Trainee, that’s what it reads from her name tag. I feel sorry for this poor girl. She didn’t know what to say during the whole time when we were waiting for the lift and during the whole process. I was so embarrassed and it ended up me started a conversation with her…… I shared my experience with my friends and it so happened that one of them had a terrible experience as well when they asked the hotel to provide baby sitting service. The hotel charged them a staff meal of HKD260 which is a good USD34, for those who have been to HK, you will know that charging a guest the staff meal of HKD260 is a joke. When he complained upon check-out, the manager on duty said to him “sorry, did you not read the fine-prints”? Hyatt, I am truly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Was not impressed”
Reviews.Author: ysouk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a harbour view room. Considering the price I paid for the room, I am quite disappointed with it. Check-in was prompt but the staff who attended me was not very friendly. The lady who attended to me during check-out was more amiable and always have a smile on her face. The view from the room was nice but I would prefer the view from Kowloon. The bed is comfortable but the amenities in the room was disappointing compared to another hotel where I paid around the same price. The hotel room has an old CRTV (not LCD TV). There were only a few packets of tea and coffee. The toiletries were also average and there was only one roll of toliet paper in the bathroom. The room looks old too. The hotel is near the convention centre but a short distance from the MTR. You can get a much better room in another hotel. If you want a great harbour view, you should consider a hotel in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: RMJK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, but great or exceptional. There are several pros and cons to the hotel. Pros: - very spacious rooms with spacious bathroom - very comfortable bed - good in-room facilities and accessories Cons: - while they say 'harbour view', it actually lands up to be a view of cranes working on a worksite opposite the hotel. This can get very noisy at times. - not the friendliest of receptionists. - I had requested for a room on a higher floor and check-out one hr later than normal. Both the requests were turned down, inspite of the hotel being empty! Not the best hotel that I have stayed in. Will definately try some other hotel next time in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Good but inconsistent service.”
Reviews.Author: mtwojo
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is a beautiful hotel with a great location. The pool deck has great harbor view, and those doing business at the convention center would be hard pressed to find a better spot. Additionally, it is a 5 minute walk to the Star Ferry Pier and about a 5-10 minute walk to the Wan Chai metro stop. Together, they give you quick access to both Kowloon and Central. My only reservation about the hotel is the service. They were either 100% attentive or not at all. People always held doors for us and and greeted us with a smile. Having said that, one day, our room wasn't cleaned until 5:30 PM. The next day it was 10 A.M.. When they mistakenly billed us for 3 extra days, they wouldn't take the charges off (even though we had documentation). When dinning in their cafe, you either got 5 servers at your table at one time or none at all. You never knew which it was going to be. Bottom line, I would stay here again, but for the price, I might try a different high end hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Charleyquant
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times over the years and have never been disappointed. The rooms are great - really funky and modern ( my dream bedroom would look like this!) and often have fabulous views over Victoria Harbour and the west of the island. Service is impeccable even finding me phone chargers in the middle of the night for an obscure phone. Food in all the restaurants is great and always good service. You definitely get what you pay for at this hotel but is perfect for business and affordable for a couple of nights for a leisure visitor.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For -- Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: RichmondCA
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 with 4 pieces of luggage. We used the GH's van service from the airport to the hotel. The van was the way to go. The GH's porters greeted us at the airport and whisked us and our luggage to the waiting luxury van. It was a service that we paid for and was well worth it given how tired we were after the flight and we didn't need any further hassles of getting the right transportation to get to our hotel. At the hotel, we were whisked to our room and the lady checked us in from our room. No need to stand in line at the front desk. How efficient. We had slippers waiting for us. We were able to fit our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 daughters ages 9 and 12) comfortably into their room. We had a king bed and a rollaway. The room was extremely clean and had light wood finishings and furniture. My only complaint was that the sofa was a bit worn out. With the rates they charge, they should be maintaining the sofa a bit better than that as customers expect that sort of thing from a 5* hotel. The bathroom was clean and spacious with marble and high-end fixtures. The hotel restaurant was perfect for us to eat breakfast at every day. They had a wonderful breakfast buffet with lots of juices to choose from. We even had dinner there a few times. The food is delicious. Expensive but you get what you pay for. The hotel has a great fitness room which my husband used every morning. There was a wonderful pool with great loungers, however we had no time to use that, because there was too much to see and do in HKG. The location of the Grand Hyatt is not as bad as it seems. There is a ferry terminal that is a few minutes' walk that will take you to Kowloon. You can grab a cab to go anywhere and cabs are cheap in HKG. A short walk will take you to Hennessy Road where there's shopping. A short walk will also take you to a laundry place where you can get your clothes cleaned for a good price per pound (don't use the hotel's expensive laundry service). The hotel also took good care of our luggage while we went away to Macau for 2 nights and then also when we went away to Phuket for 3 nights. They were our "base", and took really good care of us. Overall, we had a great experience and will return when go back to HKG again.

Reviews.Title: “Boring but with excellent concierge service”
Reviews.Author: caetanomi
Reviews.Content: I just came from a not so good experience at the Grand Hyatt Beijing and this experience was quite different in a positive way. The welcoming was very good, fast and i could tell that things were working well in this hotel. During this business trip i got a really good help from the concierge staff and they helped me with a lots of things from getting special adaptors to my laptop to finding different locations. I also dined in the thai restaurant and food was very good and the manager, James was extremly helpful and friendly. So my overall judgement is that the design of the hotel is quite standard and old stylish and could need to be freshened up but the staff is very friendly which is the most important thing. Breakfast is also good and with a fantastic view of the kowlon island so i recommend having breakfast in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: mclachlan4321
Reviews.Content: Another fantastic stay at the Hyatt HK. Faultless, with impeccable service. The hotel bar JJ's is remarkably good after a long days work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: PablofromLA
Reviews.Content: Great staff at this hotel, they were all very attentive and quickly responded to all requests. The rooms were great with great view of Kowloon Island. The food was really good. There was a desert buffet that had any kind of desert you could imagine. Overall I really cant say anything bad about this property.

Reviews.Title: “There is nothing not to like Long island NY”
Reviews.Author: Surfingisfun
Reviews.Content: There is really nothing bad to say about this hotel. Ok being from NY Im used to average service and some tude. The staff at this hotel was top notch from start to finish. Polite, always there, etc. The hotel was in a great location rt near the bay, near the ferries to Kowloon and close to Central and WanChai are for shopping and nightlife ( bars clubs) The was in great shape, clean. modern etc. The lobby was very large, marble. The hotel had nice bars and restaurants. My room was great. The bed was as comfortable as Ive ever had on my travels. It was modern looking. had wireless interenet, TV with some US channels etc. The Bathroom was a bit Trumpish in that it was a lot of gold and marble, but it was clean. new, etc so no complaints at all. I dont have much to compare it to in HK, but its a great hotel, reasonable price wise for that level, and greta location. I really cant think of anything bad to say about it

Reviews.Title: “A good-for-business-travellers hotel”
Reviews.Author: maroonleaf
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed for 5 nights from 7-12 April 2008 as he attended a week-long conference at this hotel. It was top-notch with marbles & golds everywhere in a superb location facing the famous panaromic Harbour front view. However, as I was there for holiday (read: shopping, good local delicacies) I feel that most times, the hotel is too formal, ie. perfect for businessmen, but over the top for casual holiday makers. Everyone wears black suits/formal attires & the pace is very HongKong-like. Efficient but walks faster & speaks faster. Warm smiles felt obligatory. There were no shuttle buses to famous spots & even the info desk guy was not well-informed of the airport shuttle bus schedule (which actually pick up/drop off at the Convention Centre next door). Other than this, the hotel room is superb. Thick walls = quietness. To-die-for soft bed, comforter & pillows. My hubby & I had wonderful rest & deep sleep throughout our stay! Fantastic bathroom (large shower & bathtub). I was not impress with their toiletries (shower gels, shampoo, conditioner & body lotion) though, as they were like the generic brand that we expect from other non-5 star establishment. Location-wise, it was about 10-15mins walk to the nearest MRT (WanChai). Would stay for business but if on holiday, we would choose elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View, Near Convention Center.”
Reviews.Author: LiangShanBo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite nice, as would be expected for a Grand Hyatt. Had a room with a harbor view but probably better views can be had on the Kowloon side looking at Central. Service was most excellent (maybe the best I've had in Asia). Only complaint (besides the price) was that there were not enough outlets in the rooms. I could only find one after much searching (under the desk) and finally another one in a closet near the desk (a few days later). Not enough outlets for the modern road warrior (e.g., charge the laptop or BlackBerry, but not both at the same time until all the outlets were located). Also, the hotel bar JJ's was hopping. Most happening hotel bar I've been at in a while in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent "bling" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Farnham_Flyer
Reviews.Content: Public areas too bling for me - lacking in taste - rather like the Trump Tower in NYC....The Champagne Bar is a much classier part of the building and prices are not too horrendous. The rooms are more expensive than the Renaissance next door (and with which it shares outdoor facilities). Given the Renaissance is going through a revamp - it might be catching up. Great location and views of the Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: IDRIVEURIDE
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Hong Kong achieved a milestone in totally shattering my expectations. I have stayed on property in the past and my reviews were mixed. In the past I found the staff to be a bit detached and the service lacking. The recent return, I quickly noticed what must have been a total reorganization of leadership. From the very first moment to the last, the service, attention and quality of stay very substantially enhanced. Location on HKI is excellent for the sites as well as the majority of business and convention events, being located adjacent to the convention center. Easy access to the Airport Express, taxi services, short walk if desired to Star Ferry and outer island ferry terminal as well. Kowloon across Victoria Harbor which is always a very entertaining journey. The Hyatt is truly an excellent experience surely I will enjoy again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnGaltUs
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel, good location on Hong Kong and close to convention center and ferry station, tram, markets. The rooms were perfect in condition, comfort, size and view. We had a garden/pool view. Plans to spend time in the room might warrant upgrading to harbour view for ~US$90/night. In any event, the higher the floor the better. Buffets for lunch, dinner and desert were huge, comparable in price to other hotel restaurants but at US$40-60/person substantially more than eating locally. Facilities like pool and gym were top quality. Service was excellent at all levels. Really no negatives for our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Karen1769
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in a Harbour view room in September 2007. We arrived early on Sunday morning and although check in was 12:00, we were escorted to our room very efficiently which was great after a 12 hour flight from the UK. We paid extra for the view. However, the room was on the corner so unfortunately the view was mostly of the town below not the view over to Kowloon. Room was on the smallish size but was adequate. The marble bathroom was large. We ate in the One Harbour Road restaurant which had great views. We drank most evenings in the Champagne Bar - be warned, men must wear appropriate attire - something we forgot about as we were on our way to Thailand and the suitcase was packed with shorts & flipflops!! Most of the clientele staying at the hotel were business people. Good band in JJ's. We went to the Peak but the queues were huge - top tip: buy a ticket for Madam Tussauds and you get to jump the queue. Bit of cheesy fun anyway. We had lunch in the Peak Lookout Restaurant which was great. Make sure you take a visit to the Ocean Park to see the panda bears. There is also a great cable car (not so great if you hate heights) but great views. Also, don't bother with a transfer from the airport - take the train. Its a very effiicent service and takes about 30 minutes to Hong Kong Island. When we left Hong Kong, we checked our bags at the airline desk at the train station and didn't see them again until we arrived in Thailand. The only disappointment I had was that we did not have enough time to enjoy the swimming pool as it had great views. We stopped for breakfast there on our last day very briefly and it looked lovely. It is quite expensive, our room bill was rather large (probably something to do with the champagne bar!!) but hey, we were on holiday. If you want to experience the real Hong Kong , probably best to stay on Kowloon as it is fairly quiet near the Grand Hyatt. We had to take taxis to Central going out in an evening

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: stephanie_cate
Reviews.Content: This hotel had amazing views and it was easy to get everywhere in Hong Kong by taxi or ferry!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but need improvement”
Reviews.Author: jcjchung
Reviews.Content: Our family got 3 rooms at the hotel. The presidential suite and 2 standard rooms on the Grand Club level. I will write my review based on a standard harbour view grand club room which I stayed in. It costs HK$4000 per night. Grand Hyatt HK is an institution and boast to be one of the top 10 hotels in the world. The service at the hotel was excellent, room is spacious and is well equiped. The standard you would expect from any Hyatt worldwide. I was however disappointed at a few minor things. At HK$4000/ night you would expect the latest technology such as flat screen TVs, the Grand Hyatt HK did not have this (not even in the presidential suite). Breakfast at the Grand Club level was disappointing. There was little choice- I was really looking forward to a smorgasbord of Hyatt buffet breakfast but was disappointed. Overall, it is a nice hotel but its not worth the HK$4000 price tag. I also wouldnt rate it in my top 10 hotel list. It felt like I was staying at any other 5 star hotel. There was nothing special about it. I agree the hotel is in a strange location in an islolated part of Wan Chai with little food choice in the area. The 10 min walk to the MTR station is also annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not like a Mandarin or Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: Paulo B
Reviews.Content: Nice room.Nice bathroom.Service was adequate but certainly not even close to a Mandarin standard, uneven quality of waiters.Indeed as a previous reviewer said, English proficiency is not their strongest asset.Good gym.Pay a bit more and stay at the Peninsula in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrektheWorld
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, however it is not as nice as some of the other Grand Hyatts in China. The first room they gave me had a very bad mold smell, and I had to move out of that room and be put into another room. After I switched rooms, I was very happy. The hotel is clean and very nice. The staff here is excellent! They gave me lots of recommendations and directions to sites. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like coming home”
Reviews.Author: coral_reef_diver
Reviews.Content: I've been to many hotels in the world. But you will hardly find a hotel that has earned the word "5 Star" like this one. The location is ideal to explore Hong Kong and is directly located to the new build convention center. I found everything, I've expected. Limo-airport-service, wide breakfast selection, exclusive and clean rooms, sauna, pool (on the 11th floor), spa, delicious restaurants, etc. But apart of the facilities, what I liked most as it appears very rarely in such big hotels was the fact that you get the feeling from the first moment on, you became part of the Grand Hyatt family. Employees remember your name and when you return to your hotel, it feels like coming home. When you're traveling a lot, that feels really good. I enjoyed my stay a lot and would always come back.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking hotel - glad I wasnt paying”
Reviews.Author: DelfromLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the best part of three weeks whilst in HK on business. Amazing place, very modern, one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in, great facilities and as always in HK staff were amazing. If you can go then do, but I would only go if work was paying.....too expensive for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but dirty pool!”
Reviews.Author: LZ_Cheong
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nites in Grand Hyatt. The room was spacious and clean. It was near the Star Ferry, about 7 min walk. The MTR was a bit further, about 15 min walk. The pool was located on the 11th floor, it was a decent size. Staffs were attentive. There is quite a nice view. However, I was shocked at the water condition. There were lots of flies, floating in the water! I do not expect this in a 5 star hotels. To be fair to the hotel, I checked the pool everyday around 10am. I was able to see clearly as I was wearing googles. It is shameful for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Paradise”
Reviews.Author: oxon-ottawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one week in January 2007. This is possibly the best large hotel I have stayed at for business travel. For personal travel with anyone this would also be a fantastic hotel, but rates are very pricey. Top 10 best things about the hotel, some suggested improvements, and then Top 5 things to do in HK listed below. Top 10 things about the Grand Hyatt 1 One Harbour Road restaurant- amazing view and fantastically flavoured food not to be missed 2 The pool and workout facilities on roof-level: I swam while overlooking the HK harbour watching eagles soar overhead. 3 The second floor lounge and jazz band & piano player; great spot for business or pleasure in casual setting 4 Fantastic staff: punctual and efficient 5 Well appointed rooms: very modern but comfortable 6 Amazing location, especially if you are using the HK Convention Centre 7 The sweeping lobby: put the "Grand" in Grand Hyatt 8 The spa services 9 Breakfast served in the hotel, 1st floor, is delicious and good variety for both Western and Asian traveller 10 Great taxi service Improvements/ drawbacks 1 Staff need to be better versed on HK tours and sightseeing opportunities 2 Other than in-hotel restaurants (which are fantastic but expensive) you should get directions to local restaurants if walking, as HK at night for a new guest can be difficult to navigate, especially weird old mall complex to one side of hotel 3 Room service menu could be more diverse 4 Price warning: this hotel is very expensive for the average traveller! Top 10 things to do in HK 1 Take a boat or ferry at night to take photographs of the skyline 2 Shop in the local markets, negotiate every price! 3 Take the tram up the HK hill for a great view-- but go early & don't plan on eating there, restaurant selection is poor and crowded 4 Visit the bird market & the flower markets right beside it 5 Take a day trip on the train to mainland China 6 Take a boat trip out to a fish restaurant down the harbour 7 On day one of your trip ask hotel for a recommendation for a tailor and get shirts, suits, dresses, anything you want made to measure while you are there. VERY affordable 8 Go to Rio Pearl for pearl shopping - the concierge will direct you 9 Visit colonial HK- the old court house and Anglican church 10 Marvel at the architecture including the Bank of China

Reviews.Title: “Nice place....if someone else is paying ;-)”
Reviews.Author: S3CR3T3X3C
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Hong Kong is somewhere you have to stay once if you are in the neighborhood. It is an impressive, glitzy, glam ode to Las-Vegas-ian excess but somehow manages to avoid the tacky zone. I have stayed here many, many times on business and always found it somewhere one looked forward to staying (unlike so many other places...). I love the location in Wan Chai. I love the Zen type peaceful decor and their dessert buffet is to die for ;-) ! The service left me a bit cold but just take a look at that lobby and you'll forget about that service as you gawk. Stay here. Especially if someone else is paying.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: Gingersnaps
Reviews.Content: Service was great but room was looking kind of tired. Food outlets were good. Location was so-so. Would prefer a hotel in Admiralty like The Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “slightly confused...”
Reviews.Author: icarussix
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a week and the service was good, the staff were friendly and greeted us with smiles and courtesy at all times. One major problem was with the outrageous deposit on the room. We stayed for one week and were charged for double our stay on a credit card which basically over ran the limit. This would have been understandable had they informed us of this charge before hand so be aware of hidden charges or deposits, The staff told us this is common in all hotels in hong kong and the world although in my experience the staff are misinformed. decent hotel but lacking in policy and explanations

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming and overrated”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Grand Club (executive) room and, while the harbour views are wonderful, everything else was disappointing. First and foremost are the beds. In a time when five-star hotels are offering the best in mattresses and linens, the Grand Hyatt's bed was so mushy (there's no other word for it) that I awoke with back and shoulder pain each morning. Beware too that, if you are on a club floor (for which you pay a premium), you will be charged for internet access (HK$160 per day). Further, you will be charged if you wish to access the wireless system (even in the club lounge). Tacky. The club lounge has a very nice restaurant-like setting with table service at both breakfast and for evening snacks/cocktails. Unfortunately, the food for the most part was mediocre. The hotel's Chinese restaurant, One Harbour Road, offers very good food in a nice setting and at surprisingly reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt looked after all of us”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: Our Harbour view rooms were comfortable and the view was well worth grabbing them. There were 8 of us in two families on a deal from our airline and we'd seen some reviews commenting on the hotel's emphasis on VIPs. And VIPs we weren't! But from dealing with a bag lost en route, arranging a doctor to replace medicine, booking us all into a restaurant that didn't take bookings etc etc, the staff all made it a fun and happy visit. It is a little out of the way I guess, for business perhaps, but I agree that it's easy to get taxis, or take the subway and the ferry from Wan Chai to Kowloon is close and enjoyable. We loved the Intercontinental last time we were here and loved this one too.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Rosler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three night over Xmas. After reading other reviews we booked a room with a partial harbour view. We took the Merc limo from the airport - well worth the 50 quid. Check in was seamless and quick and we were showed to our room. The room was pretty spacious and very modern. The bathroom's are maybe not to everyone's taste but lovely to use. The service as the hotel is excellent and the concierge were very helpful. The breakfast were pretty good and came in at about 20quid. The location of the hyatt is pretty good with taxis to town only costing a couple of quid, and the bus stop to stanley market and the star ferry only minutes away. We paid about £170 a night and I loved the hotel. The spa and pool on the roof are well postioned too, we never ate there in the evening but I would recommned the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Plateau Spa”
Reviews.Author: tanseaway
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Grand Hyatt during the October 2006 - peak season in HK. Got a nice surprise as I was upgraded to a Plateau Spa room. The room has a very heavy Japanese influence - the bed is a mattress on the floor, the large Japanese-style bathtub, the way the room is designed for shoes to be removed at the door as one does in Japanese homes... the list goes on. The balcony overlookind the harbour is a nice bonus. The shower and bathtub walls are made of clear glass, so this room is really only suitable for singles or couples. The toilet is (thankfully) well enclosed and concealed in a corner enclosure by itself. The rest of the hotel is starting to look a little dated, although immaculate. The lobby is a little dark for my tastes. Service is impeccable as one would expect of one of Hyatt's finest. The location is excellent for convention visitors as it is connected to the convention centre... shoppers may be inconvenienced slightly as the main shopping areas are elsewhere. Still, HK is not that large and the subway is a 10 minute walk away. The dim sum served for brunch in the Chinese restaurant continues its status as some of the best to be found in HK.

Reviews.Title: “I really thought this hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: Vixtix
Reviews.Content: We got the shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel, but going back we stopped at so many other hotels, it's worth to pay a bit more and take a taxi. We ate in the Cantonese restaurant twice (once for Dim Sum) and thought the food, service and views were great. Could have had a bit more choice on the Dim Sum menu though. The swimming pool was a great size, but like already mentioned it closed too early. Also, service wasn't the best in this area of the hotel. We ate breakfast on the terrace one morning, but it was pretty rubbish, not much choice and they didn't seem to re-stock things very quickly or sometimes at all! Cakes were tasteless. Tea was really nice though! The Champagne Bar was really nice, although I wish they would get rid of the prostitutes that hang out there. I suppose they cannot prove that they're vying for business, although it was pretty obvious. On a good note though, they had a great singer in there and staff were very attentive; it had a very relaxing atmosphere. Room attendants were fab; they even hung my clothes up when I'd left them on the chair. There was turn down service every night. I thought overall that the staff were fantastic. The whole experience was very luxurious and civilised! I think I've gone on far too long here, but I think this hotel was the best thing about Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Looking out for Mr Big”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a night in Hong Kong on our way back from China. Check in was good, although our room (as a Hyatt Platinum member) was one of the few with little view. The hotel is certainly swish, well kept and well staffed. However, the staff seem concerned to keep the VIPs arriving happy - and less concerned with other guests! The location is quite a walk, through various overhead covered paths, into Central - but a taxi ride in is quick, and costs under HK$20. Travelling to Kowloon from the nearby Wan Chai Star Ferry wharf is literally a breeze. We only tried JJ's bar for drinks - and found the service there pleasant (with a good band performing) if predictably expensive. We would stay here again - although many HK hotels look nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but restaurant teams need work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the room and the view - the restaurant service let the place down big time. They all seemed far to interested in the local VIP's and what not and i was left to fend for my self on many occasions. Management dont seem to care about this fact either - shame they can polish this area because the rest shines.

Reviews.Title: “Class act”
Reviews.Author: sweintraub
Reviews.Content: I recently came back to Hong Kong after being an Expat 5 years ago and stayed at the Grand Hyatt because of its proximity to our office and also the great views (and JJ's). I want to get this out of the way 1st. This hotel knows how to treat someone. Classy. They just hit on every detail and are creative in delivering more service than you could expect or even fathom. Now the rooms aren't going to win any awards for contemporary design but they are beautiful and comfortable. The views are stunning. Bathrooms, beautiful. The gym is solid but I didn't pack and tennis shoes (just dress shoes and sandals) the nice australian guy at the Gym offers me some free shoes and even some help If I needed it... The meals, desk, taxi caller yada yada..all amazing. I just wish this type of treatmentwasn't so rare... Thanks again Grand Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MistyLaw2
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great service, large, nicely appointed rooms. What more could you ask for? Our room on floor 28 had a view over the harbour which was worth the price tag alone. Breakfast in the Grand Club on floor 30 was a great way to start the day. Plenty places to eat in the hotel but be prepared to pay for the pleasure of eating in them. The Japanese Keatsu offered a fantastic set menu including sushi, sashimi and much more. The pool is massive, one of the biggest in Hong Kong. We were made to feel very special which I liked. Certainly no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Strangely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningDC
Reviews.Content: Great room overlooking the bay, great spa, wonderful food, but I couldn't help feeling disappointed overall. Service wasn't that great and the hotel did look a bit dated and tired to me. They've recently done a refurb to the hotel, and some of the decor doesn't feel right. Would stay again, but no longer the grand dame of HK.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a lot to say but compliments to the chef. great hotel visually the room which i thought was just basic initiall before going there was more than basic. very comfortable with gold color plating throughout the bathroom.fast high speed internet connection for about $20usd per 24hrs. caught a limo from the airport for 730 hong king dollars. great service as they were waitng for me as soon as i got out of immigration and found their desk. the room had plenty of refrigerated snacks (you have to pay for em') the bathroom had a large tub (kind of jacuzzi) and a great shower. this was all first class and the price fits. the hotel has mediocre hospitality except the bell hops. they dont expect a tip so dont feel guilty if you dont tip anything anywhere. the hotel missed my wake-up call on my day of departure. the hotel had a bar inside with a live band which rocked. for you single guys/gals easy to bring your catch from the bar up via the 2nd floor mezzanine. the only negative i can say is about the bar because it has a lot of high dollar prostitutes pretending/acting like regular people hangin around on one side the bar and normal regular ladies who dont trust you because all the hookers on the other side. you can almost tell the difference. taxi's are cheap as it can get to get to nearby attractions and suburbs. a good 20 minute+ walk from the hotel will put you in the mainstream. i didn't like the food, but i didn't eat everything on the menu also. i brought with me beef jerky and energy bars to supplement. overall my personal rating is 9.5 out of 10 and is recommended for an easy choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PCO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here having come from the Grand Hyatt in Shangahai, what a great hotel. Impressive visually, good service, nice rooms, good restaurant, well located overlooking the harbour and a couple of minutes walk from the Star Ferry. And the singer in the champagne bar is a real doll.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but prefer FS or the Pen”
Reviews.Author: JWYeung
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt Hong Kong is one of the older Grand Hyatt hotels (Bangkok, Jakarta, HK, Taipei & Seoul) that were ambitiously conceptualized in the early 90s as grand hotels. These Grand Hyatts are easily identified by their magnificent atrium lobbies; well appointed rooms; and superior health & recreation facilities with large free form pool. However, at the turn of the century, the trend has shifted towards minimalism & contemporary design, which was quickly adopted by newer Grand Hyatts (Shanghai, Beijing) and adapted by older Grand Hyatts. Renovations were soon begun at all Grand Hyatt to achieve this format. Although older Grand Hyatts have successfully rejuvenated their rooms, F&B outlets, ballrooms, pools and building contemporary spas; one problem that they could not tackle is their lobby. Their massive size has prevented any refurbishment program to pass the budget review as renovating the entire lobby would cost a fortune. At the end, older Grand Hyatts now have a mismatch of style with the 90s lobby (some neo-classical) and minimalist for the rest. Mind you, these lobbies are still breathtaking, grand and impress most guests. This is exactly the case with GHHK of which I stayed during the Christmas. LOCATION I would agree with some reviewers that it may not be as perfectly situated as others in Central, Causeway Bay or Kowloon. Luxury travelers & shoppers would prefer Central/Kowloon’s ultra luxury boutiques; The young & trendy would prefer Causeway Bay’s hip establishments; while budget would prefer the upper Kowloon with bargain shops. At WanChai, Grand Hyatt seems to have none, hence doesn’t score well for convenience. In fact, I have the most tiring time walking through the sky bridges and the adjacent surrounding of Wan Chai that didn’t lead me to anywhere I wanted (shop or food). Sure you can hail taxi; but if this is the case, then you have no problem staying at any part of HK or any hotel – even Cyberport!. SERVICE Attentive, classy and accommodating. Jennifer checked me in with smile, warmth and managed to find the exact room I requested (facing the main pool & bits of the harbour; rather than other building’s façade and its garden – I booked a Garden Room, sadly). As usual, whenever I took photos around the hotel, there must be some security guards forbidding me (c’mon, have I got anything negative intended- it won’t be done so obviously and timely –took me half an hour wandering around). Other hotels were purely rude (esp. at the Sofitel Wentworth Sydney where the receptionist screamed over from his desk saying I couldn’t take photos without a person in the pictures -for security-: Is this dumb retarded or “I’m following policy”), but the Hyatt people done it with smile. Next was my visit to the beautiful Plateau where I requested a tour around the tatami styled room with terrace over Victoria Harbour. Anu, the receptionist showed me around with such a class yet utterly friendly. Even the staffs at the business center was very helpful, accommodating and always with a smile (sometimes a rare commodity in HK) ROOMS All harbour rooms are breathtaking needless to say; however opt for the ones facing both Kowloon and Hong Kong skyline for best view. By virtue of its design, the 3 sided façade of Grand Hyatt fronting the harbour have one side faces mostly HK skyline; one faces mostly Kowloon and one faces both (similar to Excelsior’s Deluxe Harbour View rooms). I wasn’t so lucky as I booked a Garden Room (only 8 of 27 in typical floors: rest are harbour views). Nonetheless, as I’ve studied the floor plan beforehand, I managed to secure the room with an overview of the whole pool/garden areas and a bit of harbour (Room 2105). Each room is unique, where guest will enter diagonally to a small foyer with small dressing table and a floating ward robe. This is a clever design as it provides privacy from seeing the rest of the bedrooms. Bathroom is in triangle shaped and is quite spacious (although in no way to compare with Peninsula’s or Four Seasons’ – in respond to earlier reviewer). Clad in black marble and mirrors, the bathrooms are still in the original design of the 90s while the rest of the room has been updated with minimalist décor. The circular work desk that you’ll first encounter at the end of the corridor is well placed with the TV at the further most corner of the room, which means you can comfortably watch TV from bed/work desk. Although rooms are on the smaller side (in comparison to Peninsula or FS), they are comfortable. One of the features that I felt quite odd is the way the hotel use to prevent guests from stealing/taking away in-room materials (towels, bathrobes, letter folders). On the very first page of the “in room amenities book”, Grand Hyatt listed what should not be taken away, even listing all the cost of wooden hangers, tea holders, bedside notes folders, shampoo holders, etc. I am amazed how un-classy this upper luxury hotel can be. The sad thing is in-room amenities are ‘minimalist’ too: 2 pages of notes, 2 pages of letter sheets, few bathroom amenities.. so really, there are nothing much to take away anyway!! FOOD Didn’t try the few restaurants at the hotel as opting for better ones around (Lobby Lounge: better view at InterCon’s; Grand Café: better buffet at TOO at Island Shangri-La; but the Chinese restaurant I heard is quite a legend aside from Man Wah at Mandarin and Spring Moon at Peninsula). RECREATIONAL The Plateau area impressed me, whose concept has been quickly adapted at Grand Hyatt Bangkok (Isawan) and I could imagine the potential at Grand Hyatt Jakarta’s impressive and stunningly beautiful pool area. The gymnasium has a more intimate atmosphere coherent with surrounding Plateau’s public area. Plateau breakfast is served outdoor at the big courtyard with two rows of tree planters where dining experience is directly under the trees. The spaces are amazing and quite romantic. Pool is large and free form, which should be the longest one in HK. Adjacent to Plateau is the gardens of the apartment towers which is accessible to all guest of Grand Hyatt, Renaissance Hotels and two apartments, which also include 2 tennis courts. Ironically, my astonishment of theh Plateau was short-lived. Upon checking-in at the Four Seasons, there is truly no rival to its outdoor pool area with its magnificent setting and edgeless pool –arguably the most impressive of any city hotels in the world!. OVERALL Grand Hyatt is consistently good truly befitting its Hyatt flagship hotel status. Nonetheless for the similar (or slightly higher) price range and location issue, I would prefer and recommend the Four Seasons or the Peninsula. Grand Hyatt initially impressed me, but upon staying at the Four Seasons, it just couldn’t compete with the overall FS experience. But stay here if you are on convention/expo trip.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time and we like it more and more”
Reviews.Author: Partickboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights over Xmas. Used points to upgrade to the Club floor. No change in the rooms at all as far as I could see but the Club lounge was a real boon. Just a really nice relaxing space with a great view of the harbour. Extensive breakfast buffet and just as substantial in the evening. Staff were helpful and attentive. We enjoyed it too much and rather wasted the booking to the One Harbour Road Chinese restaurant. We'd only intended catching a drink before the restaurant but were sated by the time we got down there. Really you wouldn't need anything but the lounge. We've enjoyed each of our stays here, a lot of the opinions criticise it for being a little isolated but I actually quite like that it is not sitting on top of a shopping centre like the other luxury hotels on the island side. Happily recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to Hong Kong often and have sampled both the Peninsula and Island Shangi-la, (which along with the Grand Hyatt, I would have to argue constitute the three best hotels in Hong Kong), but I continue to come back to the Grand Hyatt. Where to start. Service at this hotel is top notch, the staff is friendly and attentive, and after ten stays, I cannot honestly recall a time when I was served with anything less than a smiling face. Staff halt whatever they are doing the moment they sense you may need anything. The ladies at the business center are possibly some of the most competent and approachable I have ever come across. Club rooms are the way to go here. The club lounge is magnificent, always well staffed, and is a quiet retreat where you can look over the harbor and exhibition center below, and the buffet breakfast is fantastic, serving continental or American. Rooms themselves (both Grand and club) are modern, well appointed, and if you were to ask even those who gave a "terrible" rating for whatever reason, I'm sure they would eventually admit that the bathrooms at the Grand Hyatt are possibly the best in HK. Big and marble are how I like my bathrooms, and next to the Park Hyatt Seoul and valley wing at the Shangrila Singapore, these bathrooms are possibly the best in Asia. I left an almost empty bottle of cologne in my room once, came back three months later and there it was carefully placed on small face flanel, positioned next to the soap on the sink, awaiting my arrival. If you are a gold passport member, platinum or diamond, the staff will make a point of remembering your name from the moment you check in. Small luxuries such as [real] coffee are brought to your room free of charge at anytime you request it, as is the breakfast. Stay there five times, and you become a VIP, although its hard to grasp what this means as I have never felt as though I was anything less. Some reviews I have read on this site have stated that the location is bad as far as proximity to shopping goes, which is true if you expect the shopping to be right outside your door, and in this case I suggest you find accomodations on Kowloon. Pacific Place, possibly the best shopping mall in HK, is seven minutes walk away, and a couple of bucks if you don't like to sweat and prefer to take a cab, which would get you there faster than it would if you were right above it at the Shangri-la and had to spend half an hour waiting for the elevators that are ALWAYS full. For long haul fliers, I recommend the mercedes airport pickup, (about 790HKD if i recall), which is well worth the extra. The driver even offers a Norah Jones soundtrack along with the wet towel, bottled water and newspaper awaiting you in the back seat.

Reviews.Title: “Must be the best in HKG”
Reviews.Author: RFCMod
Reviews.Content: After staying in many top hotels in HKG this was my first trip to the Grand Hyatt Arriving after a 11 hr flight I was ready to drop So arriving in my room was bliss, the room is of top notch modern design with hidden detailing in switches and cupboards with a very bright large bathroom Bed was extremely comfortable and added towards a terrifc nights sleep Very nice cafe style restaurant on the lobby floor gave a good view out to the harbour and gave excellent service and did a terrific cooked breakfast The champagne bar again gave excellent service and is in formal and a good way to relax after a good day working in smoggy HKG This hotel is granduous to say the least and its grandeur is shown the companies who use the conference facilities for annual meetings (Microsoft to give one example) A great hotel, good location and definately one for the future

Reviews.Title: “Plateau spa, Grand Hyatt- Best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: jnice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Plateau Spa in the Grand Hyatt, Hong Kong for our honeymoon in June 2005. The location was perfect, the service was impeccable, the rooms were amazing, clean, and modern (see photos), and the food was fantastic. Can't imagine having stayed in a tiny room at the insanely touristy Peninsula across the river (we visited for tea and it was a mob scene). I highly recommend the Plateau Spa at the Grand Hyatt for an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a pity -- keeps getting worse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for a week every year since 1998. It just keeps going down hill. The service is now appalling. I was given a smoking room when I checked in, when I had explicitly asked for a non-smoking room. So they asked me to stay in the smoking room one night and moved me the next day. I had asked for an adjoining room for the kids who were joining me a couple of days later.
