When the kids arrived, the adjoining room had already been 'released' to another guest and they offered a room a couple of doors down. When I nixed that, they suggested I move yet again. When they moved me, I realized the rooms they gave me were smoking rooms! The hotel also specializes in nickel-and-diming their guests. You want to buy a ticket to Disney, that will be an extra $30 per ticket for 'delivery'. You want to pay for the tickets by credit card, that will be an extra 5%...an on and on... What a pity.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShabbyChique
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GHHK for 9 days earlier this month and it was a great experience. The hotel is by no means cheap, however ask about corporate discounts when you book. We didn't get one, but our travelling companions did get a reduction in their room rate because of a company affiliation. Speaking of reservations, be very careful when you do book your room at this property. Get your reservation info in writing, if you can. Our booking was made by calling Hyatt's toll-free call centre in North America. The room rate we were quoted and that we reserved under was based on double occupancy, but when time came to check in, GHHK tried to tell us that the rate we got was for single occupancy and wanted to charge us an additional $200/night for a second person. Unfortunately, it took some arguing and getting the on-duty manager involved, but the issue was ultimately resolved quickly and our original room rate was charged. FYI - HK hotels charge a 13% hospitality tax per night, so don't be surprised if your bill looks larger than expected when you check out. Our room was fantastic: clean, modern, well-appointed, free green tea, huge marble bathroom with glass shower and separate soaker tub, comfy king-size bed, extra pillows and a great view of the harbour (for which we paid extra). We also got a free daily continental breakfast delivered right to our room because I was a Gold Passport member (Hyatt's loyalty program). There is housekeeping twice a day (morning and night) and the GHHK boasts the biggest hotel pool in HK with awesome chaise longues at poolside. This hotel also has the most friendly, courteous staff I have ever encountered. However, there are a few not-so-great things about GHHK. For instance, it's one of the few major HK hotels that does not offer shuttle service from Chek Lap Kok (HK Int'l Airport) and it's also not the best location in terms of proximity to shopping, restaurants and entertainment. As an acknowledgement of this, GHHK offers a free London cab shuttle service to Central, which is the major "action" area on HK Island. However, there is no schedule for the shuttle, you can't book it in advance, it runs only until 6pm and it's not available on weekends. We only used it once during our stay. Also, the pool has no set hours. It's open from dawn until dusk, which means don't count on going for a swim past 5:30pm. The on-site restaurants were great, but pricey, as is usually expected with hotel dining. The Grand Café on the main level offers a nice menu selection and a fantastic evening dinner buffet until 10pm. The hotel's flagship restaurant, One Harbour Road, is easily the best authentic Chinese food I've ever had. The hotel is close to 7-11 and Starbucks, as well as the Star Ferry terminal to Kowloon and within short walking distance to the MTR (subway). For some reason, the concierges at GHHK do nothing but recommend taking a taxi when you ask for directions somewhere. We were keen to walk many places and found this lack of help frustrating. But overall, our stay here was great and we would recommend it to others considering booking a room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 nites, end October. What impressed me was the level of service they had right from the doorstep (the valets/porters/concierge/recepton) and even to the restaurant staff's service. Excellent service and always with a smile! And the housekeeping was meticulous and generous. The room was very comfortable with a huge bed and comfy pillows. The bathroom was luxurious with a long bath and a shower stall and marble flooring and gold finishing. It's a little out of the way, by the waterfront, but that gives it the fantastic view from the rooms of the skyline and of the harbour. You go to sleep watching the many colourful lights on the buidlings across at the CBD area. Getting around from the hotel was easy as there were plentiful cabs throughout the day. And the Star Ferry Terminus is within walking distance (at most an 8 min walk). The chinese restaurant served up delicious fare. And the poolside cafe was a great place to have lunch and to unwind after a hectic morning's shopping. Great stay!
